Archivist.synopsis: Dialogue with Archivist in House of Hope. He is the person who keep records on all Raphael projects. Half-way between a curator and an accountant, he's incredibly repressed, and obsessed with record-keeping and accounts.He's the model of Order and tidiness, but being from the hells, he's also hiding a dark secret. In his case, he's a masochist, and finds the concept of breaking rules thrilling, though he hates to admit it.Strict and severe, he will try to keep order unless the player leans on his vices or fears, in which case he'll become flustered and dismiss them to the boudoir.

AD_ArchivistReactionOnKillingSkeletons.synopsis: Archivist in House of Hope doesn't care if players will kill off skeletons in his Archive. They're Raphael's debtors that won't let them so easy

HopeSpirit01.synopsis: First dialogue with Hope's spirit that happens after players get to House of Hope.Hope is a captive within the House, and has been driven mad by years of psychological and physical torture. Raphael keeps her alive because she astonishes him - and the reason for that is that no matter what he does to her, she holds onto the last of her hope and optimism. That fascinates him.In this dialogue, Hope introduces players to the House of Hope. They have arrived here deliberately, knowing that they are not invited, and that it is likely dangerous.Hope appears to warn them of that danger, and to help them, and also introduces the deranged vibe of the area.Note: When Hope speaks in all-caps, she is showing the manic side of her personality. Louder, more intense, and almost like she's possessed by a different, more deranged version of herself.

YurgirFarewell_7.speaker: Yurgir
YurgirFarewell_7.text: You fought well - we could use such strength in the Blood War.

YurgirFarewell_29.speaker: Karlach
YurgirFarewell_29.text: You did us a favour, Yurgir, so I'm going to let that slide.
YurgirFarewell_29.context: NodeContext: Not super mad, but triggered by Yurgir's suggestion that she'd be a good flighter in the blood war

YurgirFarewell_25.speaker: Yurgir
YurgirFarewell_25.text: Ever tempted to rejoin the ranks, soldier?

YurgirFarewell_24.speaker: Player
YurgirFarewell_24.text: I'd rather spend what time I have left saving my own world.

YurgirFarewell_22.speaker: Yurgir
YurgirFarewell_22.text: But down here in the hells, Karlach, I think you would burn bright forever.

YurgirFarewell_5.speaker: Player
YurgirFarewell_5.text: Been there, done that. Never again.

YurgirFarewell_14.speaker: Yurgir
YurgirFarewell_14.text: Understandable. You have your own battles to fight.

YurgirFarewell_11.speaker: Yurgir
YurgirFarewell_11.text: It was an honour to fight alongside you, Karlach.

YurgirFarewell_21.speaker: Player
YurgirFarewell_21.text: I'd rather die a thousand deaths. But I miss the simplicity of bashing skulls, I suppose.

YurgirFarewell_4.speaker: Yurgir
YurgirFarewell_4.text: Soldiers like us aren't made for complications, Karlach. Better to be pointed at prey, and to kill without question.

YurgirFarewell_3.speaker: Yurgir
YurgirFarewell_3.text: At least in the Blood War we know our adversaries.

YurgirFarewell_17.speaker: Yurgir
YurgirFarewell_17.text: Until then, keep your flame bright, and make ash of those who oppose you.

YurgirFarewell_27.speaker: Yurgir
YurgirFarewell_27.text: Now I'm free of Raphael's blasted contract, I can return to the frontlines.

YurgirFarewell_18.speaker: Player
YurgirFarewell_18.text: I think you've earned a break.

YurgirFarewell_19.speaker: Yurgir
YurgirFarewell_19.text: Hunting shadows in a temple for a hundred years was a break.

YurgirFarewell_15.speaker: Yurgir
YurgirFarewell_15.text: I'll have slain a score of demons before you have your next hot meal.

YurgirFarewell_30.speaker: Player
YurgirFarewell_30.text: I have my own frontline to return to, in Baldur's Gate.

YurgirFarewell_0.speaker: Yurgir
YurgirFarewell_0.text: Whoever your enemies are, they have good reason to fear you.

YurgirFarewell_10.speaker: Yurgir
YurgirFarewell_10.text: And I'll gladly lend you my skills against them when the time comes.

YurgirFarewell_9.speaker: Yurgir
YurgirFarewell_9.text: Until then, good luck to you, little rabbit. You're a finer hunter than any wolf.

YurgirFarewell_1.speaker: Player
YurgirFarewell_1.text: Good luck, Yurgir. You're a fine warrior.

YurgirFarewell_20.speaker: Yurgir
YurgirFarewell_20.text: And you are a worthy ally.

YurgirFarewell_28.speaker: Player
YurgirFarewell_28.text: You're not going anywhere - I'm cleansing this place of every devil, you included.

YurgirFarewell_26.speaker: Yurgir
YurgirFarewell_26.text: It is dishonourable to slay an ally. But I'm not surprised - mortals have no honour.

HopeSpirit02_41.text: Hello again, little mouse. The price for speaking is steep, but I must give warning.
HopeSpirit02_41.context: NodeContext: speaking in hushed tones, pleased to see the player

HopeSpirit02_62.text: Your prize is just ahead, in the Archive, but you can't take it yet, and even if you could, you mustn't.
HopeSpirit02_62.context: NodeContext: excited to tell you you're close to your prize, but disappointed to break the news that you can't take it yet

HopeSpirit02_45.text: IN THIS HOUSE THIEVES ARE MELTED LIKE BUTTER AND SPREAD ONTO TOAST
HopeSpirit02_45.context: NodeContext: raising volume as she blurts out a warning, losing control of her emotions

HopeSpirit02_33.text: Shhhh... I'm doing it again I'm doing it again.
HopeSpirit02_33.context: NodeContext: shushing hersel after an outburstf, and fussing at heself

HopeSpirit02_50.speaker: Player
HopeSpirit02_50.text: I need you to stay calm, Hope, and guide me.

HopeSpirit02_61.text: I can I shall I can I shall.
HopeSpirit02_61.context: NodeContext: determined, repeating as a mantra to give herself confidence

HopeSpirit02_17.text: The Archivist is the key, but he's as stubborn as a king and as serious as a heart attack.
HopeSpirit02_17.context: NodeContext: relaying important information as straightforwardly as she can

HopeSpirit02_15.text: EXPLOIT HIS PIDDLING WEAKNESSES AND MAKE HIM GROVEL

HopeSpirit02_11.text: Oh no. They hear me... Speak quickly, speak softly, you know how this goes.
HopeSpirit02_11.context: NodeContext: trying to compose herself, slowing down more than usual before the ellipsiss, and then speaking quickly ad quietly

HopeSpirit02_19.speaker: Player
HopeSpirit02_19.text: Concentrate on speaking softly and without emotion.

HopeSpirit02_22.speaker: Narrator
HopeSpirit02_22.text: *You steady your mind, and prepare your questions.*

HopeSpirit02_55.speaker: Player
HopeSpirit02_55.text: Is there anyone else I should be aware of in the Archive?

HopeSpirit02_85.text: SISTER MY SISTER, OH WHAT HAVE YOU DONE, SOLD ME FOR SOUL SCRAPS, TORMENT ME FOR FUN
HopeSpirit02_85.context: NodeContext: outburst, intentional rhyme, sad lament

HopeSpirit02_56.text: My dearest sister Korrilla is in there too, pretending to browse the collection, acting all nonchalant. She's up to something.
HopeSpirit02_56.context: NodeContext: composing herself after an outburst, then suspicious

HopeSpirit02_53.text: She won't let me escape. Not never ever never ever.

HopeSpirit02_42.speaker: Player
HopeSpirit02_42.text: Sounds like we'll have more luck with the Archivist.

HopeSpirit02_65.text: He fears authority figures. Perhaps his teacher took a strap to him and left a deep impression at an early age.
HopeSpirit02_65.context: NodeContext: composing herself after an outburst on the previous line - trying to relay important information

HopeSpirit02_71.text: There's one regular visitor that he particularly fears... She is... shhhhhhh...
HopeSpirit02_71.context: NodeContext: decreasing volume as she realises somebody is listening in... hushing herself

HopeSpirit02_0.speaker: Narrator
HopeSpirit02_0.text: *A crack like a breaking bone. Hope winces.*

HopeSpirit02_24.speaker: Player
HopeSpirit02_24.text: Who does the Archivist fear, Hope? I need a name.

HopeSpirit02_13.text: SCARIER THINGS THAN YOU LITTLE MOUSE

HopeSpirit02_47.text: Verillius... Verillius Receptor. A High Inquisitor of Zariel. Officially entitled to audit Raphael's collection.
HopeSpirit02_47.context: NodeContext: in pain, delivering this information is costing her a lot. Slower than her normal speech patterns as she fights the pain.

HopeSpirit02_27.text: Her true form is so gargantuan and mind-scarring to behold that she takes on many guises when she visits.
HopeSpirit02_27.context: NodeContext: in awe as she describes a terrible devil

HopeSpirit02_44.text: PLAY YOUR PART WELL AND YOU CAN BE ONE OF THOSE BLASPHEMOUS GUISES

HopeSpirit02_16.text: IT'S ON THE TIP OF MY TONGUE BUT THEY SLICED OFF THE TIP OF MY TONGUE

HopeSpirit02_84.speaker: Narrator
HopeSpirit02_84.text: *Hope vanishes from sight, and the House seems to tighten around you like a constricting artery.*

HopeSpirit02_81.speaker: Player
HopeSpirit02_81.text: I need to get you out of here, Hope, before that jailor kills you.

HopeSpirit02_25.text: YOU CAN'T THERE IS NO HOPE FOR HOPE

HopeSpirit02_77.text: Not without the Hammer. It can shatter all infernal chains, including those that hold me.
HopeSpirit02_77.context: NodeContext: composing herself after an outburst, telling us what we need to know to help her

HopeSpirit02_83.text: I will endure 'til you find me. Hope always does. And when you do find me -
HopeSpirit02_83.context: NodeContext: speaking calmly and sadly, and pausing on the final word

HopeSpirit02_8.text: WE WILL RIP OUT THEIR GIZZARDS

HopeSpirit02_58.text: BUT FIRST GO GET THE HAMMER

HopeSpirit02_2.text: BUT FIRST GO GET YOUR CONTRACT

HopeSpirit02_29.text: Once you do, the House will bare its teeth, and you'll only have a few minutes to get me out of my prison before Raphael arrives.

HopeSpirit02_34.text: AND THEN IT ALL COMES TUMBLING DOWN
HopeSpirit02_34.context: NodeContext: gleeful outburst, despite the horror of the situation

HopeSpirit02_59.speaker: Player
HopeSpirit02_59.text: You're about as helpful as a blunt dagger.

HopeSpirit02_37.text: AND YOU'RE ABOUT AS GRATEFUL AS A FLOWER IN A FURNACE
HopeSpirit02_37.context: NodeContext: outburst of exasperated indignation aimed at uncooperative player

HopeSpirit02_40.text: I'm doing the best I can. Please don't abandon me.

HopeSpirit02_32.speaker: Player
HopeSpirit02_32.text: She won't have a choice - I'm getting you out of here. Just tell me how.

HopeSpirit02_43.speaker: Player
HopeSpirit02_43.text: How should I deal with the Archivist?

HopeSpirit02_52.speaker: Player
HopeSpirit02_52.text: Why can't I just take what I came for?

HopeSpirit02_68.text: TRY IT AND YOU WILL BE NOTHING BUT BONES

HopeSpirit02_7.context: NodeContext: composing herself and lisitng out the things that might happen as if they're very specific and scientific, despite the vagueness of her warning

HopeSpirit02_9.text: Trigger the alarm, and Raphael will come swooping home on wings of malice to rip out your soul.

HopeSpirit02_78.text: Being here is a violation of so many subclauses and stipulations in your contract that Raphael will snuff out your soul the minute he catches sight of you.

HopeSpirit02_18.text: YOU SHOULDN'T HAVE SIGNED IT YOU MAGNIFICENT MORON
HopeSpirit02_18.context: NodeContext: outburst, exasperated with the player for signing a contract with Raphael

HopeSpirit02_35.text: Unfortunately, it's the most prized item in the collection, so the 'no touching' rule is strictly enforced.
HopeSpirit02_35.context: NodeContext: thinks very little of the 'no touching' rule, treating it like a kid would treat a rule not to speak in class

HopeSpirit02_23.text: The Archivist is the key. EXPLOIT HIS FEARS AND LUSTS.
HopeSpirit02_23.context: NodeContext: calm and serious on first sentence, and then an outburst of excited emotion on the second

HopeSpirit02_36.text: The only thing that matters is the Hammer.

HopeSpirit02_21.speaker: Player
HopeSpirit02_21.text: I don't need any advice - I already know the masterword to dispel the magic protecting the artefacts.

HopeSpirit02_73.text: My heart just skipped a beat - you might just pull this off.

HopeSpirit02_67.text: PLEASE PLEASE PLEASE TAKE ME WITH YOU WHEN YOU LEAVE

HopeSpirit02_5.speaker: Narrator
HopeSpirit02_5.text: *You hesitate a moment too long, and Hope begins to fidget and panic.*

HopeSpirit02_26.text: I DON'T HEAR A THING, SIR JAILOR, EXCEPT FOR THE GENTLE CRACKING OF MY RIBS
HopeSpirit02_26.context: NodeContext: calling out apologetically to an off-screen presence, with panic, attempting to placate

HopeSpirit02_54.speaker: Player
HopeSpirit02_54.text: Think two steps ahead, plotting out your queries in advance.

HopeSpirit02_49.speaker: Player
HopeSpirit02_49.text: Focus your efforts on formulating concise questions.

HopeSpirit02_39.text: I AM BEING BOILED ALIVE AND FILLED WITH A THOUSAND PINS
HopeSpirit02_39.context: NodeContext: exasperated, the player is NOT taking her predicament seriously

HopeSpirit02_60.text: But since you asked so politely, I'll calm myself.
HopeSpirit02_60.context: NodeContext: composing herself after an outburst

HopeSpirit02_72.speaker: Player
HopeSpirit02_72.text: You're more of a hindrance than a help.

HopeSpirit02_46.text: AND YOU'RE MORE OF A HATSTAND THAN A HERO
HopeSpirit02_46.context: NodeContext: nonsensical outburst after being insulted

HopeSpirit02_38.text: Sorry. Let's try this again. Apologies, apologies, apologies. You're not a hatstand at all.
HopeSpirit02_38.context: NodeContext: composing herself after an outburst

HopeSpirit02_12.speaker: Player
HopeSpirit02_12.text: Focus, breathe with intent, and the flames that scorch your mind will recede, for they are nothing.

HopeSpirit02_75.text: Slight problem. The flames are scorching my backside as well as my mind. But I like your optimism, and I can help.
HopeSpirit02_75.context: NodeContext: awkwardly letting the player know tha tthey're advice didn't help all that much, but genuinely pleased that they're trying their best

AD_PortalBaldursGate_1.speaker: Narrator
AD_PortalBaldursGate_1.text: *Salty air, the patter of feet: Baldur's Gate lies beyond.*

AD_DamnedSoul01_0.speaker: Errant Soul
AD_DamnedSoul01_0.text: Did I ever live anywhere else but here? Did I ever live?

AD_FireDebtor03_Idle_0.speaker: Shameful Eternal Debtor
AD_FireDebtor03_Idle_0.text: Don't look at me... don't look at me.
AD_FireDebtor03_Idle_0.context: NodeContext: distressed, talking to himself, losing grip on reality

AD_FireDebtor03_Idle_1.speaker: Shameful Eternal Debtor
AD_FireDebtor03_Idle_1.text: Shouldn't be here... none of us should.
AD_FireDebtor03_Idle_1.context: NodeContext: distressed, talking to himself, losing grip on reality

AD_FireDebtor03_Idle_2.speaker: Shameful Eternal Debtor
AD_FireDebtor03_Idle_2.context: NodeContext: distressed, talking to himself, losing grip on reality

AD_FireDebtor03_Idle_3.speaker: Shameful Eternal Debtor
AD_FireDebtor03_Idle_3.text: How do I still owe so much?
AD_FireDebtor03_Idle_3.context: NodeContext: distressed, talking to himself, losing grip on reality

AD_MerregonDebtor05_Idle_0.speaker: Mocking Eternal Debtor
AD_MerregonDebtor05_Idle_0.context: NodeContext: Laughing quietly, in distress and trying to stop laughing

PAD_HopeBurned_0.speaker: Player
PAD_HopeBurned_0.text: The end of the line for Hope. May she rest in peace - at last.

PAD_BoudoirDisguiseWarning_0.speaker: Player
PAD_BoudoirDisguiseWarning_0.text: Better to put the debtor's attire back on. It keeps the locals quiet.

SkeletonDebtor03_0.speaker: Librarian Eternal Debtor
SkeletonDebtor03_0.text: We do not demand silence, but please keep prayers, words of encouragement, and friendly conversation to a minimum.
SkeletonDebtor03_0.context: NodeContext: a librarian calmly explaining the rules of a rather deranged library

SkeletonDebtor03_1.speaker: Librarian Eternal Debtor
SkeletonDebtor03_1.text: Welcome, welcome, please enjoy the Archive. Whispers, screams, gibbering, and panicked cries are encouraged.
SkeletonDebtor03_1.context: NodeContext: a librarian calmly explaining the rules of a rather deranged library

PAD_PortalLuscan_0.speaker: Player
PAD_PortalLuscan_0.text: Luskan, City of Sails, at the far north of the Sword Coast, in the shadow of the Spine of the World.
PAD_PortalLuscan_0.context: NodeContext: Minsc: referencing Jarlaxle, but not judging.

MerregonDebtor03_0.speaker: Loyal Eternal Debtor
MerregonDebtor03_0.context: NodeContext: crying profusely and barking like a dog

MerregonDebtor03_1.speaker: Loyal Eternal Debtor
MerregonDebtor03_1.context: NodeContext: crying profusely and barking like a dog

AD_Raphael_Combat_PermanentBeast_0.speaker: Raphael
AD_Raphael_Combat_PermanentBeast_0.context: NodeContext: flying into a rage, final words before transforming into his final infernal form

AD_FireStatue_0.speaker: Narrator
AD_FireStatue_0.text: *Wrath. The purest of all things that burn.*

AD_Raphael_Combat_01_0.speaker: Raphael
AD_Raphael_Combat_01_0.context: NodeContext: Shouting to his minions in combat

AD_CambionBust02_0.speaker: Narrator
AD_CambionBust02_0.text: *Guile. The face that masks a thousand lies.*

AD_Raphael_Combat_RadiantReaction_0.speaker: Raphael
AD_Raphael_Combat_RadiantReaction_0.text: You shouldn't play with divine fire - it will burn you.

AD_MerregonDebtor03_Idle_0.speaker: Loyal Eternal Debtor
AD_MerregonDebtor03_Idle_0.context: NodeContext: human being imitating a frightened dog bark

AD_MerregonDebtor03_Idle_1.speaker: Loyal Eternal Debtor
AD_MerregonDebtor03_Idle_1.context: NodeContext: human being growling like a dog warning people not to come near it

AD_DamnedSoul20_0.speaker: Errant Soul
AD_DamnedSoul20_0.text: Save me, Helm. Save me, Mystra. Save me.
AD_DamnedSoul20_0.context: NodeContext: desperately praying for help, and on the first line realising it's not coming.

Hope_11.speaker: Hope
Hope_11.text: Free. I never thought I would be, believed I could be, hoped I might be.
Hope_11.context: NodeContext: Triumphant, words spilling out of her in excited babble

Hope_32.speaker: Hope
Hope_32.text: But we must address the hollyphant in the room. I can see how you avoid looking at me. I must be so terribly mutilated after all these decades of torture.
Hope_32.context: NodeContext: composing herself on first sentence after an outburst. And then delivering lines solemnly, apologetic about her 'appearance', though it's not her fault

Hope_6.speaker: Hope
Hope_6.text: Don't hold back. Tell me how bad it is.

Hope_53.speaker: Hope
Hope_53.text: I'd blush if they had left me any skin to redden, and I would kiss you if they had not torn off my lips!

Hope_29.speaker: Hope
Hope_29.text: We both know that's not true, but thank you for being so kind.
Hope_29.context: NodeContext: with a sad smile - player is being kind to her, undeservedly as far as she knows

Hope_15.speaker: Hope
Hope_15.text: You truly are the kindest fool I've ever met.
Hope_15.context: NodeContext: pitying the player, despite her affection for them

Hope_27.speaker: Player
Hope_27.text: Seriously, there's nothing wrong with you. Physically, at least.

Hope_82.speaker: Hope
Hope_82.text: I hope that was a compliment.

Hope_9.speaker: Player
Hope_9.text: Let's just get out of here.

Hope_75.speaker: Hope
Hope_75.text: We'll carve our way to the entrance hall, and chop Raphael into messes.

Hope_20.speaker: Hope
Hope_20.text: That's the hopeful version, of course. The likely version is that WE ARE THE MESSES AND HE IS THE CHOPPER.
Hope_20.context: NodeContext: first sentence is her considering her previous optimiism, and then she delviers the pessimistic version with just as much manic glee

Hope_47.speaker: Player
Hope_47.text: Hideous. I can barely stand to look at you.

Hope_63.speaker: Hope
Hope_63.text: I shall find a breathable sack to wear on my noggin. But only after we escape.
Hope_63.context: NodeContext: accepting that somebody just told her she was hideous, and offering a solution that should be pleasing to everyone

Hope_26.speaker: Hope
Hope_26.text: It is absolutely preposterous that any of us are alive. Maybe we're not!

Hope_56.speaker: Hope
Hope_56.text: PINCH YOURSELF AND CHECK WE'RE NOT DREAMING THE LAST OF OUR LIVES AS WE DIE SCREAMING
Hope_56.context: NodeContext: intentional rhyme - afraid, but playful with the sing-song tone. she thought she'd just survived a terrible battle, and is now terrified that it was just a dream and she's still a prisoner

Hope_36.speaker: Hope
Hope_36.context: NodeContext: a short abrupt laugh, reacting to the player pinching themself at her command

Hope_38.speaker: Narrator
Hope_38.text: *You are wide awake, and Raphael truly is defeated.*

Hope_0.speaker: Player
Hope_0.text: We're fine, Hope. We did it.

Hope_12.speaker: Hope
Hope_12.text: Then we're not just fine, we're spectacular.
Hope_12.context: NodeContext: reassured and calm, heavy emphasis on 'spectacular' as a rare moment of joy

Hope_13.speaker: Hope
Hope_13.text: What a wonderful, jubilant, glorious day.

Hope_64.speaker: Hope
Hope_64.text: OH BUT MY POOR SISTER KORRILLA.
Hope_64.context: NodeContext: Sudden shock and grief, an outrburst of emotion

Hope_44.speaker: Hope
Hope_44.text: It is not right that she died, and it makes me want to weep an ocean.
Hope_44.context: NodeContext: quietly, composing herself after an outburst on the previous line. Holding back grief as best she can

Hope_81.speaker: Player
Hope_81.text: She made her choice when she sided with Raphael in the first place.

Hope_2.speaker: Hope
Hope_2.text: She was an entire person before she ever made that choice.
Hope_2.context: NodeContext: sad, grieving her lost sister

Hope_14.speaker: Player
Hope_14.text: I don't think there was any way to save her.

Hope_43.speaker: Hope
Hope_43.text: When we were children, she always kept the last piece of pastry for me, and bloodied the nose of the bullies who pulled my hair.
Hope_43.context: NodeContext: sad, grieving her lost sister

Hope_55.speaker: Hope
Hope_55.context: NodeContext: sad, grieving her lost sister, almost breaking into tears

Hope_1.speaker: Hope
Hope_1.text: But as a wise woman once said, there's no point in crying over spilt blood. We must go on.
Hope_1.context: NodeContext: trying to cheer herself up and to find some of her manic energy, but it's missing

Hope_30.speaker: Hope
Hope_30.text: And despite all the years I've lost, I have enough love in my heart to guide you home.
Hope_30.context: NodeContext: with genuine love and affection, with an undercurrent of grief

Hope_33.speaker: Narrator
Hope_33.text: *For the first time since you heard her voice, Hope seems calm. And the peace flows from her into you, soothing your very soul.*

Hope_5.speaker: Hope
Hope_5.text: And go where? I don't think I quite know how to be anywhere else but here anymore.
Hope_5.context: NodeContext: has undergone a fundamental change after losing her sister, and killing Raphael. Calm and collected, but with a heavy burden of grief alongside her optimism. She's feeling everything less intensely, but much more profoundly.

Hope_8.speaker: Hope
Hope_8.text: With a lick of paint and a thorough cleaning, this could be a lovely little house.
Hope_8.context: NodeContext: With a smile. Has undergone a fundamental change after losing her sister, and killing Raphael. Calm and collected, but with a heavy burden of grief alongside her optimism. She's feeling everything less intensely, but much more profoundly.

Hope_59.speaker: Hope
Hope_59.text: And I can hardly leave - after all, who would ever want to think of Hell without Hope?
Hope_59.context: NodeContext: has undergone a fundamental change after losing her sister, and killing Raphael. Calm and collected, but with a heavy burden of grief alongside her optimism. She's feeling everything less intensely, but much more profoundly.

Hope_71.speaker: Player
Hope_71.text: Where will you go now that you're free?

Hope_17.speaker: Hope
Hope_17.text: Nowhere but here. I don't quite think I know where anywhere else is anymore.
Hope_17.context: NodeContext: has undergone a fundamental change after losing her sister, and killing Raphael. Calm and collected, but with a heavy burden of grief alongside her optimism. She's feeling everything less intensely, but much more profoundly.

Hope_24.speaker: Hope
Hope_24.context: NodeContext: has undergone a fundamental change after losing her sister, and killing Raphael. Calm and collected, but with a heavy burden of grief alongside her optimism. She's feeling everything less intensely, but much more profoundly.

Hope_25.speaker: Hope
Hope_25.text: I hope I'll see Korrilla again one day, and that she'll say sorry, and I'll tell her she's forgiven.
Hope_25.context: NodeContext: has undergone a fundamental change after losing her sister, and killing Raphael. Calm and collected, but with a heavy burden of grief alongside her optimism. She's feeling everything less intensely, but much more profoundly.

Hope_54.speaker: Hope
Hope_54.text: I hope I'll find all the pieces of my mind that fell out of my head over all those years, and that I'll be able to put myself back together again.
Hope_54.context: NodeContext: has undergone a fundamental change after losing her sister, and killing Raphael. Calm and collected, but with a heavy burden of grief alongside her optimism. She's feeling everything less intensely, but much more profoundly.

Hope_40.speaker: Hope
Hope_40.text: I hope the echoes of pain will fade, and memories of sorrow will die, and that you'll visit me here some day.
Hope_40.context: NodeContext: has undergone a fundamental change after losing her sister, and killing Raphael. Calm and collected, but with a heavy burden of grief alongside her optimism. She's feeling everything less intensely, but much more profoundly.

Hope_4.speaker: Hope
Hope_4.text: And I hope you have a happy ending of your own.
Hope_4.context: NodeContext: a goodbye. has undergone a fundamental change after losing her sister, and killing Raphael. Calm and collected, but with a heavy burden of grief alongside her optimism. She's feeling everything less intensely, but much more profoundly.

Hope_62.speaker: Hope
Hope_62.text: I hope me and Korrilla can be a family again, that bygones can become bygones, and that we can patch up our wounds together.
Hope_62.context: NodeContext: sad and reflective, but optimistic

Hope_45.speaker: Hope
Hope_45.text: You were all the luck I needed.
Hope_45.context: NodeContext: has undergone a fundamental change after losing her sister, and killing Raphael. Calm and collected, but with a heavy burden of grief alongside her optimism. She's feeling everything less intensely, but much more profoundly.

Hope_76.speaker: Player
Hope_76.text: After all she did to you, she doesn't deserve your tears.

Hope_78.speaker: Hope
Hope_78.text: You don't know the half of what she did.
Hope_78.context: NodeContext: sad, grieving her lost sister

Hope_67.speaker: Hope
Hope_67.text: MY BEAUTIFUL SISTER IS MOSTLY INTACT

Hope_57.speaker: Hope
Hope_57.text: You could have broken her in half like a breadstick, but you didn't. I am sorry she fought you, and glad she survived.

Hope_60.speaker: Player
Hope_60.text: You're too forgiving. After all she did to you, we should have killed her.

Hope_51.speaker: Hope
Hope_51.text: She's my sister. I love her.

Hope_66.speaker: Hope
Hope_66.text: And despite all the years I've lost, I have enough love left for you as well. I hope it guides you home.
Hope_66.context: NodeContext: with genuine love and affection

Hope_58.speaker: Player
Hope_58.text: She was under Raphael's influence - she didn't deserve to die.

Hope_72.speaker: Hope
Hope_72.text: She deserves some of the blame - serving him was a choice.

Hope_10.speaker: Hope
Hope_10.text: But she was an entire person before she ever made that choice.

Hope_77.speaker: Player
Hope_77.text: I hope the two of you can reconcile.

Hope_23.speaker: Player
Hope_23.text: Incredible as it seems, we really did defeat Raphael.

Hope_61.speaker: Hope
Hope_61.text: That is incredible. We're incredible. We're spectacular.
Hope_61.context: NodeContext: reassured and calm, heavy emphasis on 'spectacular' as a rare moment of joy

Hope_69.speaker: Player
Hope_69.text: I expected him to put up more of a fight.

Hope_68.speaker: Hope
Hope_68.text: I was just about quite all right with the amount of fight he put up. If anything, I would have preferred less.

Hope_73.speaker: Hope
Hope_73.text: Are you still here, or are you but a dream?
Hope_73.context: NodeContext: lost in her own thoughts, but still happy to see the player

Hope_28.speaker: Hope
Hope_28.text: We need to grab your contract, quick as a hiccup, or Raphael will come and chew up your soul.

Hope_80.speaker: Hope
Hope_80.text: It's tempting to delay the inevitable, but this is it, the big showdown, the final act, the glorious RUIN THAT COMES TO US ALL.
Hope_80.context: NodeContext: increasing volume as she builds to a dramatic crescendo - really looking forward to this despite the very high possibility of failure

Hope_74.speaker: Hope
Hope_74.text: THERE IS ALSO THE SLIM POSSIBILITY THAT WE WIN
Hope_74.context: NodeContext: Trying to be positive, but has no rational reason to be

MerregonDebtor02_3.speaker: Unclean Eternal Debtor
MerregonDebtor02_3.text: Step aside, now. Raphael might return at any time.

MerregonDebtor02_5.speaker: Unclean Eternal Debtor
MerregonDebtor02_5.text: Away! This is Raphael's chamber pot.

MerregonDebtor02_1.speaker: Unclean Eternal Debtor
MerregonDebtor02_1.text: Its admirer. Its protector. It is my one true beloved.

MerregonDebtor02_2.speaker: Player
MerregonDebtor02_2.text: Do you know when Raphael will come home?

MerregonDebtor02_6.speaker: Unclean Eternal Debtor
MerregonDebtor02_6.text: I never know. I just wait, so, so nicely.

AD_HopeWarns_3.text: Remember that rancid disguise I gave you? Wonderful, wasn't it?
AD_HopeWarns_3.context: NodeContext: as if remembering the good old days, even though this all happened in the very recent past

AD_HopeWarns_1.text: IT DOESN'T FOOL ANYONE IF YOU ACT LIKE AN ASS AND BREAK THE RULES

AD_HopeWarns_0.text: Everything's falling apart VERY QUICKLY. Grab your contract, then fetch me, and we'll scarper.
AD_HopeWarns_0.context: NodeContext: trying to keep a lid on her panic, but not managing all that well

AD_HopeWarns_2.text: Everything's falling apart VERY QUICKLY. You need to bring the Hammer to my prison right now.
AD_HopeWarns_2.context: NodeContext: trying to keep a lid on her panic, but not managing all that well

AD_SoulPillar04_0.speaker: Narrator
AD_SoulPillar04_0.text: *Your nerves rattle and your skin shivers. The pillar contains thousands of angry souls, eager to escape.*

AD_SoulPillar04_1.speaker: Narrator
AD_SoulPillar04_1.text: *The area around the pillar is cold enough to make your teeth chatter.*

Archivist_SpeakWithDead_12.speaker: Narrator
Archivist_SpeakWithDead_12.text: *The corpse does not stir. It will answer no more questions.*

Archivist_SpeakWithDead_11.speaker: Archivist
Archivist_SpeakWithDead_11.text: Raphael's... archivist... a most important man...

Archivist_SpeakWithDead_3.speaker: Archivist
Archivist_SpeakWithDead_3.text: Maintained... the collection... and legal documentation...

Archivist_SpeakWithDead_9.speaker: Player
Archivist_SpeakWithDead_9.text: How did you end up in the House of Hope?

Archivist_SpeakWithDead_15.speaker: Archivist
Archivist_SpeakWithDead_15.text: Calculated... true value of my soul... then sold it...

Archivist_SpeakWithDead_6.speaker: Player
Archivist_SpeakWithDead_6.text: How can I get the Orphic Hammer?

Archivist_SpeakWithDead_1.speaker: Player
Archivist_SpeakWithDead_1.text: How do I get the contract?

Archivist_SpeakWithDead_5.speaker: Archivist
Archivist_SpeakWithDead_5.text: And... every other fluid... look to the boudoir...

Archivist_SpeakWithDead_16.speaker: Narrator
Archivist_SpeakWithDead_16.text: *The spell's power wanes. You can ask no more questions.*

Archivist_SpeakWithDead_18.speaker: Narrator
Archivist_SpeakWithDead_18.text: *The corpse seems willing to speak - but not to its killer.*

AD_Raphael_Combat_YurgirBetrayerDied_0.speaker: Raphael
AD_Raphael_Combat_YurgirBetrayerDied_0.text: That's what happens when you choose the losing side, orthon.

AD_Raphael_Plaque1_0.speaker: Narrator
AD_Raphael_Plaque1_0.text: *There can be no hell without hope.*

SkeletonDebtor02_0.speaker: Librarian Eternal Debtor
SkeletonDebtor02_0.text: Just look. Exquisitely arranged down to the last thread. If you see him, tell him how beautiful it is.

SkeletonDebtor02_1.speaker: Librarian Eternal Debtor
SkeletonDebtor02_1.text: Everything in its place. Everything perfect. All for him.

AD_ArchivistReactionOnHittingKorrilla_0.speaker: Archivist
AD_ArchivistReactionOnHittingKorrilla_0.text: We're all tempted to swat the warlock from time to time, but please refrain from violence within the Archive.

PAD_EmperorBlocked_0.speaker: Player
PAD_EmperorBlocked_0.text: I don't hear the Emperor. It can't reach us here, I guess.
PAD_EmperorBlocked_0.context: NodeContext: Jaheira line: Not actually a question, just confirming a grim suspicion.

AD_SpilledGlass_0.speaker: Narrator
AD_SpilledGlass_0.text: *The spilt wine is laced with the perfume of an exquisite poison - an unexpected treat.*

Emperor_AfterHouse_36.speaker: Lae'zel
Emperor_AfterHouse_36.text: You slaughtered a devil in his own home, and returned empty-handed? You've made better decisions.
Emperor_AfterHouse_36.context: NodeContext: All Emperor lines in this scene, telepathic.

Emperor_AfterHouse_59.speaker: Lae'zel
Emperor_AfterHouse_59.text: A curious thing - to enter into a devil's home, and make it out alive.
Emperor_AfterHouse_59.context: NodeContext: All Emperor lines in this scene, telepathic.

Emperor_AfterHouse_16.text: I trust you saw the error of your ways. Do not err again.

Emperor_AfterHouse_69.text: So you wormed your way into the devil's lair.
Emperor_AfterHouse_69.context: NodeContext: All Emperor lines in this scene, telepathic.

Emperor_AfterHouse_17.text: All to steal the Orphic Hammer.

Emperor_AfterHouse_8.text: I hope your ambitions end there.

Emperor_AfterHouse_27.text: I have already told you that the githyanki prince only wants to see you dead. But it seems you still do not trust me.

Emperor_AfterHouse_56.speaker: Lae'zel
Emperor_AfterHouse_56.text: Open the Prism. I trust Gith's heir over a wretched ghaik.

Emperor_AfterHouse_38.speaker: Player
Emperor_AfterHouse_38.text: Let me into the Prism. I trust Gith's heir over a wretched ghaik.

Emperor_AfterHouse_3.speaker: Player
Emperor_AfterHouse_3.text: I do trust you. I just like to have insurance.

Emperor_AfterHouse_57.text: That is not my definition of trust.

Emperor_AfterHouse_23.speaker: Player
Emperor_AfterHouse_23.text: You're a mind flayer. Can you blame me for not trusting you?

Emperor_AfterHouse_33.text: His domination is what keeps you free. You know this already.

Emperor_AfterHouse_21.text: Still, you would test our alliance.

Emperor_AfterHouse_40.text: You are falling into the same trap as the Chosen.

Emperor_AfterHouse_53.text: Their distrust of one another is their undoing.

Emperor_AfterHouse_58.text: We must not make the same mistake. We must work together.

Emperor_AfterHouse_46.speaker: Player
Emperor_AfterHouse_46.text: I'll work with you, but I'll never trust you.

Emperor_AfterHouse_63.text: Nonetheless, our fates are bound. And in the absence of a happier union, I will accept a useful one.

Emperor_AfterHouse_73.text: You may think yourself ingenious for having slain a devil.

Emperor_AfterHouse_22.text: But you have merely ironed out a wrinkle.

Emperor_AfterHouse_76.text: The elder brain will not be such an easy foe.

Emperor_AfterHouse_82.text: It is time we resume our journey to find it.

Emperor_AfterHouse_6.speaker: Player
Emperor_AfterHouse_6.text: I promise I won't use the hammer.

Emperor_AfterHouse_68.text: I wish I could trust you, but that you felt you needed to have it at all tells me that you are not worthy of that trust.

Emperor_AfterHouse_31.speaker: Player
Emperor_AfterHouse_31.text: I never asked to be stuck with you.

Emperor_AfterHouse_67.text: I could say the same of you.

Emperor_AfterHouse_5.speaker: Player
Emperor_AfterHouse_5.text: Be that as it may, Orpheus deserves to be free.

Emperor_AfterHouse_79.text: When he wakens from his incarceration, what do you think he will make of you? The one who bears the spawn his very nature bends him to revile?

Emperor_AfterHouse_15.text: And even if you survived him, what of the elder brain? Without the protection I leverage for you, you would be enthralled in an instant.

Emperor_AfterHouse_49.speaker: Player
Emperor_AfterHouse_49.text: All right. You've made your point.

Emperor_AfterHouse_26.speaker: Player
Emperor_AfterHouse_26.text: I'll find another way to survive. One that doesn't involve abusing a githyanki.

Emperor_AfterHouse_61.text: Careful. You will make a mind flayer laugh.

Emperor_AfterHouse_78.speaker: Player
Emperor_AfterHouse_78.text: So you keep saying, but why should I believe you?

Emperor_AfterHouse_9.text: Act upon your disbelief, and you will not even live to regret your actions.

Emperor_AfterHouse_72.text: And destroyed the contract that bound you.

Emperor_AfterHouse_30.text: The contract you tried to hide from me.

Emperor_AfterHouse_0.text: Did you think I wouldn't find out?

Emperor_AfterHouse_32.text: Did you think that you would quietly infiltrate the devil's home with me nestled right within your thoughts, and mask your true intentions from me?

Emperor_AfterHouse_65.text: The contract you never should have signed.

Emperor_AfterHouse_4.speaker: Player
Emperor_AfterHouse_4.text: I regretted it the moment I signed it.

Emperor_AfterHouse_60.text: Good. Then you did the right thing by destroying it.

Emperor_AfterHouse_19.speaker: Player
Emperor_AfterHouse_19.text: I destroyed it. You should be happy.

Emperor_AfterHouse_2.text: You realised the error of your ways, and corrected them.

Emperor_AfterHouse_42.text: But you would do better not to err in the first place. Especially when there is so much at stake.

Emperor_AfterHouse_18.text: You saw for yourself what the Chosen are capable of.

Emperor_AfterHouse_24.text: But did you also see their weakness?

Emperor_AfterHouse_28.text: Yes, in a manner of speaking.

Emperor_AfterHouse_71.text: It was their union that made them.

Emperor_AfterHouse_51.text: They had an almost flawless plan to dominate Faerûn. But their distrust is their undoing.

Emperor_AfterHouse_81.text: We must not fall into the same trap. We must trust one another.

Emperor_AfterHouse_62.speaker: Player
Emperor_AfterHouse_62.text: Fine. From now on, I trust you.

Emperor_AfterHouse_20.text: Good. If we can count upon each other, then we may count one advantage in our favour.

Emperor_AfterHouse_47.speaker: Player
Emperor_AfterHouse_47.text: I was curious. I wanted to understand what the devil had to offer.

Emperor_AfterHouse_29.text: There is only one thing to understand about a devil - it serves only itself. Anything it promised to deliver, it would recover tenfold.

AD_PetrifiedDebtor1_0.speaker: Narrator
AD_PetrifiedDebtor1_0.text: *A petrified debtor. Impossible to tell how long she's been there, but likely longer than she deserved.*

AD_KorrillaIsWaiting_1.speaker: Korrilla
AD_KorrillaIsWaiting_1.text: Well, well, well. Look what we have here.

HopeSpirit03_5.text: The Archivist told you to cool off in the boudoir. Well, here it is.

HopeSpirit03_11.text: horrid place where pleasure is pain and pain is pleasure and hope cannot live at all

HopeSpirit03_4.speaker: Player
HopeSpirit03_4.text: Any advice before I head inside?

HopeSpirit03_6.text: Everything in this House exists for Raphael's pleasure, and Raphael's pleasure alone.

HopeSpirit03_21.text: That includes Raphael himself, whatever form he takes.

HopeSpirit03_14.text: ICKY AND STICKY AND GRIMY AND SLIMY
HopeSpirit03_14.context: NodeContext: describing sexual acts with childish apprehension, rhyming is intentional. She's making the language playful to try and lessen her anxiety

HopeSpirit03_0.speaker: Player
HopeSpirit03_0.text: Do you think there's anything that might help inside?

HopeSpirit03_23.text: Nothing's stopping you from taking a peek inside.

HopeSpirit03_19.text: BUT YOU MIGHT GET MUCH MORE THAN AN EYEFUL

HopeSpirit03_27.text: I don't like it here. This is Raphael's private chamber, where he does his private things.

HopeSpirit03_10.text: The kind it's not polite to talk about.

HopeSpirit03_3.text: GRINDING AND GROANING AND BINDING AND MOANING
HopeSpirit03_3.context: NodeContext: describing sexual acts with apprehension, rhyming is intentional. She's making the language playful to try and lessen her anxiety

HopeSpirit03_18.text: If the days in Avernus had an end, this is where he'd spend the nights.
HopeSpirit03_18.context: NodeContext: apprehensive. Avernus is the name of the hell in which Raphael lives

HopeSpirit03_16.text: He's all business up front, but you know what comes after business. Pleasure. And Raphael does like to pleasure himself.
HopeSpirit03_16.context: NodeContext: the double entendre isn't intentional on her part - she's deeply concerned about the info she's giving here

HopeSpirit03_17.text: Yes - it's his favourite place, where he keeps his favourite things.

HopeSpirit03_8.speaker: Player
HopeSpirit03_8.text: Could be something useful hidden in there.

PAD_PortalMenzoberranzan_0.speaker: Player
PAD_PortalMenzoberranzan_0.text: Menzoberranzan, City of Spiders. Of course Raphael has dealings in the depths of the Underdark.

ImpDebtor01_0.speaker: Waltzing Eternal Debtor
ImpDebtor01_0.context: NodeContext: Counting out a waltz rhythm while crying to himself.

ImpDebtor01_1.speaker: Waltzing Eternal Debtor
ImpDebtor01_1.text: One, two, three; one, two, three...
ImpDebtor01_1.context: CinematicNodeContext: The fellow waltzes in place on his own, a terrified look on his face.NodeContext: Counting a waltz rhythm to himself in a panic, tears in his eyes, in absolute fear and pain

ImpDebtor01_2.speaker: Waltzing Eternal Debtor
ImpDebtor01_2.text: Don't look at me! I'm - I'm dancing! I love to dance! One, two, three; one, two, three.
ImpDebtor01_2.context: NodeContext: With absolute sorrow and pain in his voice. Contrast between words and actions.

FireDebtor02_1.speaker: Perfect Eternal Debtor
FireDebtor02_1.text: You can't be! No one can. No matter how straight we stand, how much we smile.

FireDebtor02_8.speaker: Perfect Eternal Debtor
FireDebtor02_8.text: I tried. I tried. But I don't think I can ever be good. Instead I'll be perfect.
FireDebtor02_8.context: NodeContext: Gradually becoming more and more panicked and tearful as they go on

FireDebtor02_0.speaker: Player
FireDebtor02_0.text: No, but I wish I was.

FireDebtor02_7.speaker: Perfect Eternal Debtor
FireDebtor02_7.text: No wishes here. Only Hope - and that hurts more than any of us.

FireDebtor02_6.speaker: Player
FireDebtor02_6.text: No - and I like it that way.

FireDebtor02_4.speaker: Perfect Eternal Debtor
FireDebtor02_4.text: Don't. You'll be unmade and remade until your spine is straight, feet together, look at me when I'm talking to you.
FireDebtor02_4.context: NodeContext: Panicked rambling that segues into him mimicking being shouted at by his master (Raphael)

FireDebtor02_3.speaker: Perfect Eternal Debtor
FireDebtor02_3.text: I'll be good. I swear it. You must be good too!

PAD_PortalBaldursGate_0.speaker: Player
PAD_PortalBaldursGate_0.text: We have our own portal to take us back to Baldur's Gate.

AD_Raphael_Plaque6_0.speaker: Narrator
AD_Raphael_Plaque6_0.text: *Here, the chaos of the world is dimmed. Here, the violence of life is pacified. Here, there is order.*

AD_Treasures02Plaque_1.speaker: Narrator
AD_Treasures02Plaque_1.text: *When the Orphic Hammer strikes like thunder, even Astral chains are torn asunder.*

AD_Treasures02Plaque_3.speaker: Narrator
AD_Treasures02Plaque_3.text: *The ink is dry, the contract signed, the threads of fate, shall now unwind.*
AD_Treasures02Plaque_3.context: NodeContext: rhyme on 'signed' and 'unwind' is intentional

AD_SoulPillar03_0.speaker: Narrator
AD_SoulPillar03_0.text: *You feel the hunger and desire of countless souls, bound to the pillar, unable to escape.*

AD_SoulPillar03_1.speaker: Narrator
AD_SoulPillar03_1.text: *A faint spark of arcane power flickers across the surface of the pillar.*

MerregonDebtor05_1.speaker: Mocking Eternal Debtor
MerregonDebtor05_1.context: NodeContext: Explosive laughter in the player's face.

AD_PrisonSkeleton01_0.speaker: Narrator
AD_PrisonSkeleton01_0.text: *It's hard to say if this sorry soul's demise should be mourned or celebrated, as a release from whatever torment they were forced to endure.*

ROM_Incubus_23.text: A lost little mouse is running through the House.

ROM_Incubus_17.context: CinematicNodeContext: The Incubus is scantily clad, looking exactly like Raphael lying on the bed in an expectant, almost beckoning position. Later we will  reveal he's just an incubus

ROM_Incubus_169.speaker: Karlach
ROM_Incubus_169.text: Oh gods. What the fuck have I stumbled into.

ROM_Incubus_57.text: A thief in the night, greedy and here to take.

ROM_Incubus_52.text: Why are you here, little thief?

ROM_Incubus_68.text: Raphael? Ha! No. You will have a far crueller master than Raphael, soon. But what inspired you to pay him a visit?

ROM_Incubus_51.speaker: Player
ROM_Incubus_51.text: I seek the Orphic Hammer. You can't stop me.

ROM_Incubus_1.text: Hmmm... Raphael all but spent himself to get that Hammer. And you want to take it off him?

ROM_Incubus_85.text: This is very naughty. Whatever are we to do?
ROM_Incubus_85.context: CinematicNodeContext: Lounging and languid over the bed, power entirely in their court.

ROM_Incubus_67.text: Why don't we play a game? You win, I give you everything you desire. But you'll enjoy yourself more if you lose...

ROM_Incubus_158.text: Good, little thief, good. Keep going like this, and you'll get to live.
ROM_Incubus_158.context: CinematicNodeContext: Cut to the Incubus eyeing the party lustily, when back, party is in their underwear.

ROM_Incubus_140.text: You'll be crying out my name soon, you'd better know it. I am Haarlep, Raphael's personal incubus, glamoured and transfigured to look like him.

ROM_Incubus_75.text: I'm a perfect copy. He only ever wants to sleep with himself. What's better than the devil you know, eh?

ROM_Incubus_9.speaker: Narrator
ROM_Incubus_9.text: *His violating stare sees more than all of you. It sees potential.*

ROM_Incubus_78.text: Before we continue, I want to make sure you're comfortable.

ROM_Incubus_99.speaker: Haarlep
ROM_Incubus_99.text: Sometimes, when he's feeling adventurous, Raphael will ask me to change into the 'Archduchess Raphael'.
ROM_Incubus_99.context: CinematicNodeContext: Temporarily shows you the fem version of the incubus, as an invitation.InternalNodeContext: We are placing succubus dummy here with another voice and body

ROM_Incubus_180.speaker: Haarlep
ROM_Incubus_180.text: I can take her form, if you choose. A simple swap pales in comparison to what you are about to do for me.
ROM_Incubus_180.context: CinematicNodeContext: Still fem RaphaelInternalNodeContext: We are placing succubus dummy here with another voice and body

ROM_Incubus_154.speaker: Narrator
ROM_Incubus_154.text: *It suddenly dawns on you: This creature is of the Hells. They could touch without being harmed, if you want them to.*

ROM_Incubus_28.speaker: Player
ROM_Incubus_28.text: I'll admit. I have dreamed of lying with Raphael. Undiluted and raw.

ROM_Incubus_26.speaker: Karlach
ROM_Incubus_26.context: NodeContext: Disgusted. Player said they've thought of Raphael romantically.

ROM_Incubus_60.speaker: Haarlep
ROM_Incubus_60.text: Oh? Have you? You know, you need not run away should you win. You can stay here if you wish.

ROM_Incubus_134.text: Very well, I will be Raphael himself. All of him.
ROM_Incubus_134.context: CinematicNodeContext: Transforms into male Raphael form

ROM_Incubus_110.context: InternalNodeContext: Starting with this node, every Speaker 1 answer can be told by either Incubus or Succubus. The proper speaker will be assigned to this speaker slot

ROM_Incubus_105.speaker: Lae'zel
ROM_Incubus_105.text: Do what you want. Don't expect me to applaud you when it's over.
ROM_Incubus_105.context: NodeContext: Your partner is about to sleep with an incubus and possibly lose their soul

ROM_Incubus_184.speaker: Shadowheart
ROM_Incubus_184.text: Careful. I doubt Raphael's associates dispense pleasures of the flesh out of charity. There's bound to be a catch.
ROM_Incubus_184.context: NodeContext: Your partner is about to sleep with an incubus and possibly lose their soul

ROM_Incubus_15.context: CinematicNodeContext: As soon as the player lies back on the bed, the Incubus looms over them from the foot of the bed

ROM_Incubus_82.speaker: Narrator
ROM_Incubus_82.text: *Any thought of resistance or control is fading. You will obey, giving yourself body and mind to them.*

ROM_Incubus_95.speaker: Player
ROM_Incubus_95.text: Let Haarlep do as they please.

ROM_Incubus_64.speaker: Player
ROM_Incubus_64.text: Resist their charms, and hold onto your free will.

ROM_Incubus_114.speaker: Narrator
ROM_Incubus_114.text: *It's hopeless. Their hold on you is as warm as a blush, and as tight as a manacle.*

ROM_Incubus_165.text: Don't worry about a thing - you are right where you need to be.

ROM_Incubus_133.text: You will make a pretty feast.

ROM_Incubus_46.speaker: Narrator
ROM_Incubus_46.text: *You retain a trace of free will, but it is one drop in the ocean of their desire. It will not last.*

ROM_Incubus_65.speaker: Narrator
ROM_Incubus_65.text: *Every kiss is as tender as a last goodbye. Every touch a lie of true love.*
ROM_Incubus_65.context: CinematicNodeContext: [SCENE] They come sit on top of you, very suggestive and then bend over to kiss you.

ROM_Incubus_143.speaker: Narrator
ROM_Incubus_143.text: *It is every sensation of a lifetime of love, all at once. Your body trembles with impossible expectation. Unable to resist, a voiceless scream erupts from your mouth: 'Haarlep...'*

ROM_Incubus_106.text: Hmmmm... you are so, so delicious.
ROM_Incubus_106.context: CinematicNodeContext: [SCENE] *He slowly lowers himself, clawed finger scratching your body.*

ROM_Incubus_97.speaker: Narrator
ROM_Incubus_97.text: *The moment she joins with you, your mind folds over double.*
ROM_Incubus_97.context: CinematicNodeContext: Shot of the player's impossibly pleasured face

ROM_Incubus_32.speaker: Narrator
ROM_Incubus_32.text: *As she continues to lavish herself upon your helpless form, you stop breathing, your heart stops beating, and your mind begins to clear entirely.*
ROM_Incubus_32.context: CinematicNodeContext: [SCENE] The incubus/succubus rythmically starts moving up and down.  The world around starts to dim, until the player's naked body becomes the only thing left they can perceive, slowly going up and down on the rythm. Representation of them losing their mind.

ROM_Incubus_25.speaker: Narrator
ROM_Incubus_25.text: *Some last thought whispers in your skull, vacated by everything else but rapture -*
ROM_Incubus_25.context: CinematicNodeContext: Everything is dark, player can see their naked body, but they feel like they're in an abyss.

ROM_Incubus_89.text: Devote yourself to pleasure eternal. Stay here with me - this can be forever.
ROM_Incubus_89.context: CinematicNodeContext: Close up on the Incubus' grinning lips

ROM_Incubus_3.speaker: Player
ROM_Incubus_3.text: You can have my body, but not my mind.

ROM_Incubus_70.text: Vow that your body belongs to me.

ROM_Incubus_135.text: Give yourself to me, and I will tell you what you wish to know.

ROM_Incubus_69.text: As with Raphael's, I shall add your body to my glamour. I will gain great pleasure from you, as you.

ROM_Incubus_124.text: But you must vow it - you are mine.

ROM_Incubus_45.speaker: Player
ROM_Incubus_45.text: I vow: my body is now yours.

ROM_Incubus_131.speaker: Narrator
ROM_Incubus_131.text: *As she kisses you deeply, it feels as familiar as breathing.*

ROM_Incubus_61.speaker: Narrator
ROM_Incubus_61.text: *A last cascade of pleasure washes over you, greater than the feelings before, but it draws you back into reality.*
ROM_Incubus_61.context: CinematicNodeContext: As the player returns to full vision of the House of Hope, and the bed they were on, they see the Incubus now has their identical form, and has turned into them.

ROM_Incubus_71.text: I can't wait to explore how you work. What gets you going. What makes you sweat.

ROM_Incubus_43.text: And every time I make love in your shape, you will know. A shiver out of the blue, a tingle from beyond. You will know.

ROM_Incubus_159.text: Now, your reward for giving me such a present. I will tell you one and only one of Raphael's dirty secrets.

ROM_Incubus_87.text: Whisper it to me - what do you want to know?

ROM_Incubus_53.speaker: Player
ROM_Incubus_53.text: I want to know Raphael's secrets - can you share any?

ROM_Incubus_22.speaker: Player
ROM_Incubus_22.text: How can I find the Hammer?

ROM_Incubus_103.text: Raphael hides nothing from me, can deny me nothing... aside from what he keeps in his safe.

ROM_Incubus_148.text: The safe lingers behind the right-hand painting of Raphael. He almost spends more time staring at those portraits than he does at me.

ROM_Incubus_174.text: Although I'd love to watch you struggle to open the safe without it, this key should help. You've laboured enough, pet.
ROM_Incubus_174.context: CinematicNodeContext: Haarlep gives the key, make gesture but hide detail off camera.

ROM_Incubus_63.text: Now, shall we bid one another goodbye?
ROM_Incubus_63.context: CinematicNodeContext: [SCENE] Gets up off the bed.

ROM_Incubus_96.text: Thank you. For you. I will misuse you well.
ROM_Incubus_96.context: CinematicNodeContext: Incubus turns into you, one more time, waves goodbye. He should disappear after this scene is done.

ROM_Incubus_176.text: I did have a key to give you, but it seems a groping paw has taken it off me. If you slipped it away during our romp, I admire your flexibility.

ROM_Incubus_125.speaker: Player
ROM_Incubus_125.text: The contract I made: how can I retrieve it?

ROM_Incubus_8.speaker: Player
ROM_Incubus_8.text: Is Raphael actually any good in bed?

ROM_Incubus_31.text: But you didn't come all this way to ask that, did you? You wouldn't sell yourself so cheaply, I hope.

ROM_Incubus_91.text: A treasure like you deserves to wrap their hands around Raphael's mightiest rod. The Orphic Hammer.

ROM_Incubus_156.text: I sensed the soul within you chained to the to the contract. You do not deserve to call such a man 'Master'.

ROM_Incubus_48.speaker: Player
ROM_Incubus_48.text: My body belongs to no one but me. Never again.

ROM_Incubus_54.text: Then, this will have been the very last time you experienced pleasure. Time for the BIG death.

ROM_Incubus_178.speaker: Player
ROM_Incubus_178.text: Pleasuring thousands with my body? I'd rather die.

ROM_Incubus_39.speaker: Player
ROM_Incubus_39.text: My heart and soul are yours.

ROM_Incubus_164.text: Indeed they are, and soon they will be gone.
ROM_Incubus_164.context: CinematicNodeContext: Distant gigling can still be heard.

ROM_Incubus_177.text: Once I've eaten your heart, you as you know yourself will be gone.

ROM_Incubus_116.text: Your body will live and breathe, left alive as a loving doll to obey the wishes of me and my master.
ROM_Incubus_116.context: CinematicNodeContext: Soul leaving the overwhelmed avatar

ROM_Incubus_18.text: You will love every beast in the Hells, under my command. What a brilliant future awaits you!

ROM_Incubus_149.speaker: Narrator
ROM_Incubus_149.text: *As the incubus laps up every part of your soul, your mind is lost... once and for all.*

ROM_Incubus_120.speaker: Player
ROM_Incubus_120.text: I already lived an eternity devoted to pleasure, and it was rather dull.

ROM_Incubus_37.text: What? You can resist me? No man has resisted me before...

ROM_Incubus_155.speaker: Player
ROM_Incubus_155.text: Try to cool your desires, and push the creature away.

ROM_Incubus_170.text: Urgh, you are no fun at all.
ROM_Incubus_170.context: CinematicNodeContext: Cuts back to grounded reality, player back on the bed

ROM_Incubus_83.speaker: Narrator
ROM_Incubus_83.text: *Try as you will, every part of you craves to melt right into him.*

ROM_Incubus_84.speaker: Narrator
ROM_Incubus_84.text: *Every kiss is as tender as a last goodbye. Every touch a lie of true love.*
ROM_Incubus_84.context: CinematicNodeContext: [SCENE] They come sit on top of you, very suggestive and then bend over to kiss you.

ROM_Incubus_19.speaker: Player
ROM_Incubus_19.text: You can have my body, but not my mind.

ROM_Incubus_111.speaker: Narrator
ROM_Incubus_111.text: *You force your eyes open, drawing yourself back to reality... or so you think.*
ROM_Incubus_111.context: CinematicNodeContext: As the player returns to full vision of the House of Hope, and the bed they were on, they see the Incubus now has their identical form, and has turned into them.

ROM_Incubus_141.speaker: Player
ROM_Incubus_141.text: My heart and soul are yours.

ROM_Incubus_4.speaker: Narrator
ROM_Incubus_4.text: *As the incubus laps up every part of your soul, your mind is lost... once and for all.*

ROM_Incubus_74.speaker: Player
ROM_Incubus_74.text: Pretend to be helpless, while preparing to fight back.

ROM_Incubus_163.speaker: Player
ROM_Incubus_163.text: Gods, get me out of here!

ROM_Incubus_40.speaker: Astarion
ROM_Incubus_40.text: Darling, what are you doing? This isn't safe - you can't trust him!
ROM_Incubus_40.context: NodeContext: Your partner is about to sleep with an incubus and possibly lose their soul

ROM_Incubus_151.speaker: Wyll
ROM_Incubus_151.text: Not to sound like a second-rate writer, but - are you sure this is a good idea?
ROM_Incubus_151.context: NodeContext: Your partner is about to sleep with an incubus and possibly lose their soul

ROM_Incubus_157.speaker: Gale
ROM_Incubus_157.text: I'm telling you, this is a mistake.
ROM_Incubus_157.context: NodeContext: Your partner is about to sleep with an incubus and possibly lose their soul

ROM_Incubus_171.speaker: Karlach
ROM_Incubus_171.text: I really don't understand you sometimes.
ROM_Incubus_171.context: NodeContext: Your partner is about to sleep with an incubus and possibly lose their soul

ROM_Incubus_132.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
ROM_Incubus_132.text: This is an incubus. It will steal your soul. You may need it later.
ROM_Incubus_132.context: NodeContext: Your partner is about to sleep with an incubus and possibly lose their soul. Minthara acts annoyed

ROM_Incubus_108.speaker: Halsin
ROM_Incubus_108.text: I would urge some caution. This honey pot is full of bees.
ROM_Incubus_108.context: NodeContext: Your partner is about to sleep with an incubus and possibly lose their soul

ROM_Incubus_93.speaker: Player
ROM_Incubus_93.text: What is going to happen to me?

ROM_Incubus_33.text: I already told you. It's a surprise. Don't you like surprises?

ROM_Incubus_113.speaker: Player
ROM_Incubus_113.text: Stay as a man, if you please.

ROM_Incubus_58.speaker: Player
ROM_Incubus_58.text: The feminine form is more to my taste.

ROM_Incubus_129.speaker: Haarlep
ROM_Incubus_129.text: Then the Archduchess I shall be.

ROM_Incubus_94.speaker: Player
ROM_Incubus_94.text: I've had enough of your sick game, demon!

ROM_Incubus_49.speaker: Haarlep
ROM_Incubus_49.text: An impotent finale for an impotent show.

ROM_Incubus_11.speaker: Player
ROM_Incubus_11.text: I'm not going to play with you.

ROM_Incubus_160.text: There is one way to leave here alive, darling. Play with me? Pretty please? I'd hate to have to kill you.

ROM_Incubus_7.speaker: Player
ROM_Incubus_7.text: It was an accident - a botched teleportation.

ROM_Incubus_173.text: Do not lie. Try again. But this is your last chance.

ROM_Incubus_138.text: Hmm, I'm not sure you are exactly my type.

ROM_Incubus_62.text: Tonight, I wish to reduce the leader of your pack right down to a mewling cub. I like a challenge.

AD_CambionBust_0.speaker: Narrator
AD_CambionBust_0.text: *Pain. Become its bedfellow, and you will know true pleasure.*

Korrilla_24.speaker: Korrilla
Korrilla_24.text: Can't resist the faintest hint of a temptation, can you? I suppose that makes two of us.

Korrilla_28.speaker: Korrilla
Korrilla_28.text: That little disguise Hope gave you is adorable. I can see right through it, of course, and so will Raphael.

Korrilla_18.speaker: Korrilla
Korrilla_18.text: He's going to notice you nosing around in his house. I hope you're ready to face a very angry devil.

Korrilla_33.speaker: Karlach
Korrilla_33.text: Why don't you run off and tell him, Korrilla? You love tattling to daddy, don't you?

Korrilla_17.speaker: Player
Korrilla_17.text: I'm craftier than you think - I already convinced the Archivist that I belong here.

Korrilla_26.speaker: Korrilla
Korrilla_26.text: Hardly a challenge. Your little ploy gave him an excuse to cross-check lots of paperwork - enough to keep him happy for months.

Korrilla_35.speaker: Korrilla
Korrilla_35.text: The only thing that'll keep Raphael happy is dismantling you, piece by piece.

Korrilla_14.speaker: Player
Korrilla_14.text: How can you bring yourself to serve your sister's tormentor?

Korrilla_13.speaker: Korrilla
Korrilla_13.text: Poor, deluded Hope. She's stubborn. Raphael loves stubborn. If she'd just agree to serve him, he'd probably have released her a long time ago.

Korrilla_19.speaker: Korrilla
Korrilla_19.text: As things stand, she's his favourite toy. We're all mad here, but Hope in hell? Why, that's the definition of insanity.
Korrilla_19.context: NodeContext: Complicated feelings. Both jealous of Raphael's attention and sad because she knows her sister doesn't want it.

Korrilla_5.speaker: Player
Korrilla_5.text: Myself and Hope have formed an alliance. We're going to get out of here.

Korrilla_22.speaker: Korrilla
Korrilla_22.text: Excellent! A scheme of lunatics, a conspiracy of fools. I can't wait to see how it ends - with extreme violence and a hint of grotesque farce, I suspect.
Korrilla_22.context: NodeContext: Complicated feelings. Both jealous of Raphael's attention and sad because she knows her sister doesn't want it.

Korrilla_16.speaker: Player
Korrilla_16.text: I don't trust her any more than I trust you.

Korrilla_29.speaker: Korrilla
Korrilla_29.text: I ought to start giving you more credit.

Korrilla_0.speaker: Player
Korrilla_0.text: Raphael has something I want. Help me find it.

Korrilla_10.speaker: Korrilla
Korrilla_10.text: Unlike you, I don't have a death wish. Or an eternal torment wish.

Korrilla_23.speaker: Korrilla
Korrilla_23.text: You want my advice? Enjoy whatever life remains to you. When Raphael catches you, you'll never enjoy anything again.

Korrilla_8.speaker: Player
Korrilla_8.text: How did your sister come to be trapped here?

Korrilla_9.speaker: Korrilla
Korrilla_9.text: Raphael offered her the world; she didn't want it. He sweetened the deal; she said no. No matter how many times he upped the ante, she just laughed in his face. He didn't like that.

Korrilla_32.speaker: Korrilla
Korrilla_32.text: Eventually, he took her by force. Trapped her and swore he wouldn't let her go 'til she gave him what he wanted. Conversion.

Korrilla_27.speaker: Korrilla
Korrilla_27.text: The stubborn ass has endured more torment than any soul should be able to. Even when he took all of her skin, she held onto hope.

Korrilla_36.speaker: Korrilla
Korrilla_36.text: Raphael finds that puzzling. And he loves puzzles. You being here is another puzzle - you don't seem like you want to die.

Korrilla_25.speaker: Korrilla
Korrilla_25.text: She is. Though we've got about as much in common as a princess and a pauper.

Korrilla_37.speaker: Korrilla
Korrilla_37.text: Me? This is home base. I'm not even going to ask what you're doing here. Plausible deniability.

Korrilla_12.speaker: Korrilla
Korrilla_12.text: Don't you? I thought you had half a brain. Then again, you're here. Pretty much disproves any good sense you might've had, once upon a time.

Korrilla_11.speaker: Korrilla
Korrilla_11.text: Might want to steer clear of my sister Hope, though. She's mad as a march hare. If she'd just agreed to serve Raphael, he'd probably have released her a long time ago.

Korrilla_30.speaker: Korrilla
Korrilla_30.text: I'm surprised you're bold enough to show your face here. Raphael might tear it clean off your skull.

HopeSpirit04_18.text: When is a door not a door?

HopeSpirit04_9.context: NodeContext: the solution to the riddle, gleeful outburst. The insertion of 'jam' spoils the pun but Hope doesn't care

HopeSpirit04_12.text: You won't find a way out here. Or a way in.

HopeSpirit04_4.text: This is the Chamber of Egress. The portals here criss-cross the planes, but they won't open to the likes of you and me.

HopeSpirit04_14.text: This is how Raphael consults with his clients so efficiently, no matter the time, no matter the place.

HopeSpirit04_11.text: AND IT'S HOW HE STALKS HIS PREY

HopeSpirit04_3.text: HE LOVES YOU HE LOVES YOU NOT HE LOVES YOU HE LOVES YOU NOT
HopeSpirit04_3.context: NodeContext: using a childish sing-song to disguise anxiety

HopeSpirit04_15.text: You're the key to his future kingdom. You're his crowning glory. He has what you need but you are what he needs.
HopeSpirit04_15.context: NodeContext: composing herself after an outburst, but still excitable

HopeSpirit04_2.text: And what you need from the House is in the Archive. NOT HERE.
HopeSpirit04_2.context: NodeContext: matter of fact explanation ending with exasperated final phrase

HopeSpirit04_19.speaker: Player
HopeSpirit04_19.text: There must be something useful here.

HopeSpirit04_5.text: If you stare into the portals long enough, your mind starts to do cartwheels, and tricks you into thinking you're falling into a horrible yawning void.
HopeSpirit04_5.context: NodeContext: excitedly describing this as if it's a great use of your time, and a very fun experience

HopeSpirit04_17.text: It's one of my favourite ways to pass the time!

HopeSpirit04_8.text: But you have no time to waste, or time will waste you.

AD_DamnedSoul07_0.speaker: Errant Soul
AD_DamnedSoul07_0.context: NodeContext: a whisper, then a louder (but not shouted) command

Nubaldin_26.speaker: Nubaldin
Nubaldin_26.text: Stay out of my way, don't touch anything, and keep quiet.
Nubaldin_26.context: NodeContext: harrassed, annoyed to be interrupted

Nubaldin_22.speaker: Nubaldin
Nubaldin_22.text: I've had enough pests bothering me today, I don't need another.

Nubaldin_59.speaker: Nubaldin
Nubaldin_59.text: The Chamber of Egress - way station of the hells, providing access to Raphael's clientele wherever they might make their home.
Nubaldin_59.context: NodeContext: explaining the function of the room he's guarding, quite self-important

Nubaldin_78.speaker: Nubaldin
Nubaldin_78.text: I am its keeper, Nubaldin. Very much not at your service.

Nubaldin_5.speaker: Nubaldin
Nubaldin_5.text: The greatest pest of all! I've always thought Hope to be a dirty, empty little word. She suits it well.
Nubaldin_5.context: NodeContext: Annoyed to hear mention of Hope 'the greatest pest of all'. He hates her, but more like you might hate a mosquito that is buzzing around than a nemesis

Nubaldin_66.speaker: Player
Nubaldin_66.text: I'm trying to track her down, but she keeps flickering away.

Nubaldin_4.speaker: Player
Nubaldin_4.text: Any idea where I can find her?

Nubaldin_2.speaker: Nubaldin
Nubaldin_2.text: She pops in and out of existence all over the House, but whatever you've seen is just a trick of the light.

Nubaldin_72.speaker: Nubaldin
Nubaldin_72.text: Her corporeal form is down in the dark, bound by unbreakable chains in Raphael's dungeon.

Nubaldin_77.speaker: Nubaldin
Nubaldin_77.text: It used to be my prison - Nubaldin's very own pit of pain - I was its keeper. But that was a very long time ago.
Nubaldin_77.context: NodeContext: annoyed, reminiscing on a post he used to hold that has been taken from him

Nubaldin_70.speaker: Nubaldin
Nubaldin_70.text: A nasty little optimist, who doesn't have the good sense to lose her mind completely like the rest of us.

Nubaldin_63.speaker: Nubaldin
Nubaldin_63.text: She has a rather loathsome habit of popping into existence all over the house to shout words of encouragement to the other denizens.

Nubaldin_44.speaker: Nubaldin
Nubaldin_44.text: But her appearances are just a trick of the light.

Nubaldin_48.speaker: Nubaldin
Nubaldin_48.text: I used to work in the prison, ensuring no desirable people left the House of Hope.

Nubaldin_13.speaker: Nubaldin
Nubaldin_13.text: Now, I guard the portals to ensure that no undesirable people enter.
Nubaldin_13.context: NodeContext: emphasis on 'undesirable' to contrast with desirable in previous line

Nubaldin_54.speaker: Player
Nubaldin_54.text: Why don't you work in the prison anymore?

Nubaldin_6.speaker: Nubaldin
Nubaldin_6.text: I made a mistake. Raphael doesn't tolerate mistakes.
Nubaldin_6.context: NodeContext: a little bitter, reminiscing on a mistake

Nubaldin_8.speaker: Nubaldin
Nubaldin_8.text: We had one houseguest by the name of Gortash, a mischievous little blot of a boy, and he slipped through my fingers.

Nubaldin_0.speaker: Player
Nubaldin_0.text: I'd like to visit the prison. Where is it?

Nubaldin_30.speaker: Nubaldin
Nubaldin_30.text: What interest do you have in the prison?
Nubaldin_30.context: NodeContext: suspicious, slight emphasis on 'you' - he's wondering why a stranger would want to see the prison

Nubaldin_64.speaker: Player
Nubaldin_64.text: I'd like to spend some time tormenting the inmates.

Nubaldin_39.speaker: Nubaldin
Nubaldin_39.text: We all must have our hobbies, I suppose.

Nubaldin_18.speaker: Nubaldin
Nubaldin_18.text: All right, all right. Turn left when you exit this chamber, and you will find a hatch that leads beneath the House. That's where we keep the naughtiest souls.
Nubaldin_18.context: NodeContext: short-tempered on 'alright, alright', then giving clear directions

Nubaldin_40.speaker: Nubaldin
Nubaldin_40.text: Do watch out for the guards though. They're not as reasonable as you and I.
Nubaldin_40.context: NodeContext: a warning, but delivered with a smile - it amuses him to tell us of the danger awaiting us

Nubaldin_42.speaker: Nubaldin
Nubaldin_42.text: You're already tormenting me with all of these questions. I've had quite enough of answering them, thank you very much.

Nubaldin_32.speaker: Player
Nubaldin_32.text: Just tell me where it is before I rip out whatever's left of your soul.

Nubaldin_45.speaker: Nubaldin
Nubaldin_45.text: Turn left when you exit this chamber, and clamber down the hatch that leads beneath the House.

Nubaldin_58.speaker: Nubaldin
Nubaldin_58.text: With any luck, the guards will swallow you whole, you repugnant little scrap.

Nubaldin_10.speaker: Nubaldin
Nubaldin_10.text: Strange that they need directions. There's only one way into the prison - down the hatch at the end of the corridor on the left.
Nubaldin_10.context: NodeContext: inner thoughts - pondering, giving clear directions

Nubaldin_57.speaker: Nubaldin
Nubaldin_57.text: You're not allowed to do that! Nobody but Raphael can see my thoughts!

Nubaldin_16.speaker: Player
Nubaldin_16.text: I'd like to see the prison that held the former Lord Gortash. Where is it?

Nubaldin_43.speaker: Nubaldin
Nubaldin_43.text: I'd like to escort the killer of Gortash there myself,  but I cannot leave my post.

Nubaldin_76.speaker: Player
Nubaldin_76.text: Gortash was here? Lord Enver Gortash?

Nubaldin_65.speaker: Nubaldin
Nubaldin_65.text: Lord? Is that what he calls himself these days? The snivelling little shit.

Nubaldin_29.speaker: Nubaldin
Nubaldin_29.text: He was the son of a cobbler or somesuch meagre tradesman, sold to Raphael by his loving parents to pay off a petty debt.
Nubaldin_29.context: NodeContext: enjoying telling this horrible story

Nubaldin_73.speaker: Nubaldin
Nubaldin_73.text: Lord indeed. I used to bruise my knuckles on his whimpering little face. I'd like to have snapped his neck!
Nubaldin_73.context: NodeContext: first two words he's reflecting on how preposterous the concept of Gortash being a 'lord' is. Then building anger

Nubaldin_38.speaker: Player
Nubaldin_38.text: You'll be pleased to hear I killed him.

Nubaldin_1.speaker: Nubaldin
Nubaldin_1.text: You fabulous murderer. Oh, I wish I could have seen him grovel and beg and bleed. Maybe his soul will come to us one day.

Nubaldin_33.speaker: Nubaldin
Nubaldin_33.text: Such a splendid deed deserves a splendid reward, and there's no better reward in the hells than the pleasures and pains of the flesh.

Nubaldin_60.speaker: Nubaldin
Nubaldin_60.text: There are few sensations that can't be indulged in Raphael's boudoir. I'm not permitted to enter, but I know a secret way inside.
Nubaldin_60.context: NodeContext: a little but secretive, but not whispering

Nubaldin_12.speaker: Nubaldin
Nubaldin_12.text: Make your way ot the balcony next door, and you can find your way inside. Just make sure not to fall. It's a long way down.
Nubaldin_12.context: NodeContext: final warning delivered with a hint of amusement

Nubaldin_56.speaker: Player
Nubaldin_56.text: I'd like to snap his neck myself.

Nubaldin_61.speaker: Nubaldin
Nubaldin_61.text: Then why not get to the snapping of necks instead of the flapping of lips. I tire of you.

Nubaldin_14.speaker: Player
Nubaldin_14.text: You missed your chance. Let's talk about something else.

Nubaldin_46.speaker: Player
Nubaldin_46.text: How did Gortash end up here in the House of Hope?

Nubaldin_17.speaker: Player
Nubaldin_17.text: Gortash is dead, by my hand.

Nubaldin_49.speaker: Nubaldin
Nubaldin_49.text: Away with you. The portals are closed.

HopeGuide_0.text: NO TIME TO WASTE COME QUICKLY COME NOW

SkeletonDebtor04_1.speaker: Librarian Eternal Debtor
SkeletonDebtor04_1.text: If you intend to touch anything, please ensure your hands are clean of blood, ichor, dust, filth, and ash.

AD_Raphael_Combat_SoulWithdrawal_0.speaker: Raphael
AD_Raphael_Combat_SoulWithdrawal_0.text: My supply of souls is endless.

AD_HopeGuide_0.text: Hush hush. Quiet as quicksand, if you please.

AD_HopeGuide_3.context: NodeContext: in a very loud whisper

AD_HopeGuide_1.text: I think I guess I hope I'm right my prison is just on the right.

AD_HopeGuide_2.text: Almost there. I'm so excited I could scream.
AD_HopeGuide_2.context: NodeContext: trying to hold her excitement in

AD_HopeGuide_4.text: Just across the hall, if you don't mind.

AD_HopeGuide_5.text: Did you get distracted? Me too. BY THE TEETH IN MY ARTERIES.
AD_HopeGuide_5.context: NodeContext: first part she's being very understanding of the player's apparent confusion - then blurting out the horrible fact about her own suffering

AD_ImpDebtor04_Idle_2.speaker: Devoured Eternal Debtor
AD_ImpDebtor04_Idle_2.text: The rats, the rats, the rats!

AD_ImpDebtor04_Idle_3.speaker: Devoured Eternal Debtor
AD_ImpDebtor04_Idle_3.text: They're eating me from the inside.

AD_DamnedSoul06_0.speaker: Errant Soul
AD_DamnedSoul06_0.context: NodeContext: creepy, quiet, barely more than a whisper

AD_Raphael_Combat_SoulTaken_0.speaker: Raphael
AD_Raphael_Combat_SoulTaken_0.text: A beautiful soul - I will treasure it.

AD_DamnedSoul10_0.speaker: Errant Soul
AD_DamnedSoul10_0.text: I don't like this dream anymore.
AD_DamnedSoul10_0.context: NodeContext: scared, quiet, just above a whisper

AD_HopePleads_3.text: NO NO NO YOU CAN'T LEAVE ME HERE PLEASE DON'T

AD_HopePleads_4.text: You're just two swings of that hammer away from breaking my chains. COME TO ME.
AD_HopePleads_4.context: NodeContext: pep talk, with a slightly panicked plea on the final all-caps phrase

AD_HopePleads_2.text: If you run into Raphael while he has your contract, we'll both be dust and ash. I CAN HELP YOU
AD_HopePleads_2.context: NodeContext: explaining the very grim reality of the situation on the first sentence, and then an upbeat positive delivery on the all-caps phrase

AD_HopePleads_1.context: NodeContext: desperate plea, but with an edge of accusation (HOW DARE YOU is implied)

AD_ArchiveBalconyStatue_0.speaker: Narrator
AD_ArchiveBalconyStatue_0.context: NodeContext: reading a plaque whose creator clearly relishes evil as a good thing

AD_DeadSkeleton01_0.speaker: Narrator
AD_DeadSkeleton01_0.text: *It seems Raphael is not always the best host.*

AD_ArchivistMissingContractComment_2.speaker: Archivist
AD_ArchivistMissingContractComment_2.text: I'm afraid your contract was reclaimed by your patron, the esteemed master of this house, as is his right under the Memorandum of Understanding agreed upon at the time of signing if the party of the signatories were found to be in violation of any of several binding clauses.

AD_ArchivistMissingContractComment_0.speaker: Archivist
AD_ArchivistMissingContractComment_0.text: In short - you are dead, and your soul is his.

AD_PortalMenzoberranzan_0.speaker: Narrator
AD_PortalMenzoberranzan_0.text: *You hear nothing, sense nothing, beyond this portal to Menzoberranzan.*

AD_PortalMenzoberranzan_1.speaker: Narrator
AD_PortalMenzoberranzan_1.text: *Menzoberranzan, the jewel of the Underdark, lies beyond.*

AD_Raphael_Combat_BackToCambion_0.speaker: Raphael
AD_Raphael_Combat_BackToCambion_0.text: The price of your soul won't cover the damage you have caused!

AD_EscapingSkeleton_0.speaker: Narrator
AD_EscapingSkeleton_0.text: *This one appears to have won a taste of freedom just before they died.*

AD_KorrillaInArchive_0.speaker: Archivist
AD_KorrillaInArchive_0.text: The master is very indulgent of you, Korrilla, but I will not let you bring disorder into the Archive.
AD_KorrillaInArchive_0.context: NodeContext: Extremely agitated/panicky (scared of Raphael's wrath)

AD_KorrillaInArchive_1.speaker: Korrilla
AD_KorrillaInArchive_1.text: I'm not bringing anything, you little fusspot. I'm just here to watch the story unfold.

MerregonDebtor04_0.speaker: Immortal Eternal Debtor
MerregonDebtor04_0.text: I want to die. Let me die.
MerregonDebtor04_0.context: NodeContext: Horrific voice like a dying man.

MerregonDebtor04_1.speaker: Immortal Eternal Debtor
MerregonDebtor04_1.context: NodeContext: Horrific voice like a dying man.

AD_SuccubusCallsForHelp_0.speaker: Haarlep
AD_SuccubusCallsForHelp_0.text: Come, impies! This one won't play nice!

AD_SoulPillar02_1.speaker: Narrator
AD_SoulPillar02_1.text: *A sense of overwhelming loss flows from the pillar. There are souls inside - damned and forgotten.*

AD_Archivist_Idle_1.speaker: Archivist
AD_Archivist_Idle_1.text: Do not disturb the equilibrium of the Archive.
AD_Archivist_Idle_1.context: NodeContext: uptight, museum curator attitude - a quiet public announcement rather than directed at a single person

AD_Archivist_Idle_2.speaker: Archivist
AD_Archivist_Idle_2.text: I will restore perfect order before the master returns.
AD_Archivist_Idle_2.context: NodeContext: uptight, he´s seen something he doesn´t like. Could be as small as a speck of dust

AD_Archivist_Idle_3.speaker: Archivist
AD_Archivist_Idle_3.text: The collection is to be seen, not touched.

AD_Raphael_Plaque7_0.speaker: Narrator
AD_Raphael_Plaque7_0.text: *Do not think of what you have lost, do not dwell on your debts. Set your mind on higher things - set your mind on me.*

RaphaelAppearance_80.speaker: Raphael
RaphaelAppearance_80.text: I cannot lose to you. Not here. Not in my home. I cannot die!

RaphaelAppearance_85.speaker: Raphael
