RaphaelAppearance_85.text: Mephistopheles, hear your son! I am at your mercy - save me!

RaphaelAppearance_95.speaker: Narrator
RaphaelAppearance_95.text: *Time slows for a moment, and the air becomes thicker. The master of the house is coming.*
RaphaelAppearance_95.context: CinematicNodeContext: Players react to an initially unseen presence with trepidation - they can sense a change in the air, and feel as if they are being watched. Then smoke materialises and when it clears, Raphael is in the room. Politely threatening.

RaphaelAppearance_88.speaker: Raphael
RaphaelAppearance_88.text: There are many things in your world that I loathe. Litters of kittens, chattering children - the noise and the chaos of it all.

RaphaelAppearance_6.speaker: Raphael
RaphaelAppearance_6.text: In my world - in my HOUSE - there is order, and there are rules. You have broken the most important rule of all, and committed the cardinal sin.

RaphaelAppearance_81.speaker: Raphael
RaphaelAppearance_81.text: You went against your word, and defied our contract.

RaphaelAppearance_89.speaker: Raphael
RaphaelAppearance_89.text: In doing so, you brought the chaos of your world into mine.

RaphaelAppearance_92.speaker: Raphael
RaphaelAppearance_92.text: But your intrusion and insolence is not the most disappointing part of this whole affair. Your stupidity is.

RaphaelAppearance_20.speaker: Raphael
RaphaelAppearance_20.text: I still hold your contract, and your presence here is a violation of Clause Fifteen, Subclause Four.

RaphaelAppearance_59.speaker: Raphael
RaphaelAppearance_59.text: It is said that hope is a fine breakfast, but a poor supper. Well, the shadows grow long, and the hour is late. It's suppertime.

RaphaelAppearance_51.speaker: Raphael
RaphaelAppearance_51.text: And I'll sup on your soul.
RaphaelAppearance_51.context: CinematicNodeContext: Raphel summons flames that consume the playersInternalNodeContext: Gameover

RaphaelAppearance_84.speaker: Raphael
RaphaelAppearance_84.text: In my world - in my HOUSE - there is order, and there is decorum.

RaphaelAppearance_60.speaker: Raphael
RaphaelAppearance_60.text: You came here uninvited, and you stole from me.

RaphaelAppearance_32.speaker: Raphael
RaphaelAppearance_32.context: CinematicNodeContext: Aura of flames surround him for a moment as his rage simmers up

RaphaelAppearance_68.speaker: Player
RaphaelAppearance_68.text: You need better staff - Korrilla didn't even try to stop me.

RaphaelAppearance_52.speaker: Korrilla
RaphaelAppearance_52.text: I didn't need to. It was very entertaining watching you dig your own grave.

RaphaelAppearance_50.speaker: Korrilla
RaphaelAppearance_50.text: I permitted you the freedom to decide your own fate. You could have been smart, selfless - saved the world.

RaphaelAppearance_42.speaker: Korrilla
RaphaelAppearance_42.text: Instead, you came here and risked everything.

RaphaelAppearance_43.speaker: Raphael
RaphaelAppearance_43.text: It's the fatal flaw of mortalkind. Take away their free will, and they call you a tyrant. Allow them to indulge it, and they become tyrants.

RaphaelAppearance_35.speaker: Raphael
RaphaelAppearance_35.text: You would have been heroes if you'd only dealt fairly with me. Instead, you're not so different to doomed Karsus, over-reaching your limits, and burning your world to ash.

RaphaelAppearance_47.speaker: Raphael
RaphaelAppearance_47.text: Commander - you can salvage a trophy from these insects when I'm done with them.

RaphaelAppearance_18.speaker: Yurgir
RaphaelAppearance_18.text: These insects understand the honour of hunters better than you ever will, trickster.

RaphaelAppearance_54.speaker: Yurgir
RaphaelAppearance_54.text: They helped me to eliminate my prey beneath the shadowlands. Prey that you hoped I would never find.

RaphaelAppearance_53.speaker: Yurgir
RaphaelAppearance_53.text: And that's why I helped them find your home.

RaphaelAppearance_56.speaker: Raphael
RaphaelAppearance_56.text: You did what? I will make you suffer torments so vile, the hells themselves will shudder to see them.
RaphaelAppearance_56.context: NodeContext: quietly threatening, with heavy emphasis on 'what'

RaphaelAppearance_75.speaker: Raphael
RaphaelAppearance_75.text: And whatever torments I invent for Yurgir, I will perfect in the centuries I spend toying with your soul.
RaphaelAppearance_75.context: NodeContext: addressed to player, emphasis on 'your' as he's just switched his attention from an NPC to the player

RaphaelAppearance_21.speaker: Yurgir
RaphaelAppearance_21.text: These insects struck me down beneath the shadowlands. They are worthy opponents.

RaphaelAppearance_44.speaker: Yurgir
RaphaelAppearance_44.text: Their skulls will make fine trophies.

RaphaelAppearance_23.speaker: Player
RaphaelAppearance_23.text: Afraid to fight me alone, Raphael?

RaphaelAppearance_58.speaker: Raphael
RaphaelAppearance_58.text: You mistake efficiency and strategy for cowardice. It will be your last mistake.

RaphaelAppearance_12.speaker: Player
RaphaelAppearance_12.text: Fight with me, Yurgir, or I'll strike you down again.

RaphaelAppearance_65.speaker: Yurgir
RaphaelAppearance_65.text: To stand against a devil in his own home. That takes courage. I'm with you.

RaphaelAppearance_5.speaker: Raphael
RaphaelAppearance_5.text: How tiresome. Am I to understand that you wish to die with them?
RaphaelAppearance_5.context: CinematicNodeContext: addressed to orthonNodeContext: addressed to orthon, who has just turned on him - impatient and petulant rather than rage

RaphaelAppearance_8.speaker: Yurgir
RaphaelAppearance_8.text: I wish to fight with them.

RaphaelAppearance_74.speaker: Raphael
RaphaelAppearance_74.text: It's all the same in the end.

RaphaelAppearance_7.speaker: Yurgir
RaphaelAppearance_7.text: Few have bested me once. None have bested me twice. I stand with Raphael.

RaphaelAppearance_48.speaker: Player
RaphaelAppearance_48.text: Join the winning side - Raphael doesn't stand a chance against me.

RaphaelAppearance_0.speaker: Yurgir
RaphaelAppearance_0.text: You overestimate your abilities. I stand with Raphael.

RaphaelAppearance_33.speaker: Raphael
RaphaelAppearance_33.text: If you have any last words, make it quick. It will only take a moment to finish you.

RaphaelAppearance_25.speaker: Player
RaphaelAppearance_25.text: Wait - please. I have one final proposition.

RaphaelAppearance_63.speaker: Raphael
RaphaelAppearance_63.text: As do I, little mouse. Your flesh, my supper. Your blood, my wine. Your soul, my plaything.

RaphaelAppearance_24.speaker: Player
RaphaelAppearance_24.text: That's twice as long as Haarlep said it takes to finish you.

RaphaelAppearance_86.speaker: Player
RaphaelAppearance_86.text: I've been hoping to kill you ever since I met you.

RaphaelAppearance_49.speaker: Raphael
RaphaelAppearance_49.text: Hope. It always burns you in the end, little mouse.

RaphaelAppearance_1.speaker: Player
RaphaelAppearance_1.text: If I die, Baldur's Gate is doomed.

RaphaelAppearance_93.speaker: Raphael
RaphaelAppearance_93.text: Such a shame. I'll make sure you live long enough to watch it burn.

RaphaelAppearance_82.speaker: Raphael
RaphaelAppearance_82.text: And whether it takes a hundred years or a thousand, the Crown will be mine eventually. My time will come. Your time is over, little mouse.

RaphaelAppearance_14.speaker: Player
RaphaelAppearance_14.text: If you kill me, you'll never get the Crown.

RaphaelAppearance_31.speaker: Raphael
RaphaelAppearance_31.text: Wrong. I might have to wait another hundred years - maybe a thousand - but my time will come. Your time is over, little mouse.

RaphaelAppearance_34.speaker: Raphael
RaphaelAppearance_34.context: CinematicNodeContext: Raphael transforms into his devil form,towering ower the players who react in horror

RaphaelAppearance_70.speaker: Raphael
RaphaelAppearance_70.text: No words? No matter. You will scream before the end, little mouse.

RaphaelAppearance_46.speaker: Yurgir
RaphaelAppearance_46.text: These insects tricked me beneath the shadowlands.

RaphaelAppearance_55.speaker: Yurgir
RaphaelAppearance_55.text: I'll make a necklace of their cunning tongues.

RaphaelAppearance_17.speaker: Yurgir
RaphaelAppearance_17.text: I met these insects once before, beneath the shadowlands. I did not expect to see them again.

RaphaelAppearance_64.speaker: Hope
RaphaelAppearance_64.text: WRONG WRONG WRONG. They will save their world and smash you to smithereens.

RaphaelAppearance_76.speaker: Raphael
RaphaelAppearance_76.text: It's this charming naivety that makes your company such a joy to me, Hope. I'll even forgive this little rebellion once you're suitably chastised.

RaphaelAppearance_27.speaker: Hope
RaphaelAppearance_27.text: This isn't a rebellion, it's a revolt. I'M REVOLTING.

RaphaelAppearance_41.speaker: Player
RaphaelAppearance_41.text: Your house is in disarray - the guards couldn't stop me from freeing Hope.

RaphaelAppearance_9.speaker: Hope
RaphaelAppearance_9.text: SISTER OH SISTER I'VE WEPT AND I'VE CRIED, BUT ALL WOULD BE WELL IF YOU WERE BY MY SIDE

RaphaelAppearance_38.speaker: Raphael
RaphaelAppearance_38.text: Oh, Hope, you are such a piteous thing. All it takes is a crumb from the table, and you forget the centuries of starvation. This insolence has earned you centuries more.
RaphaelAppearance_38.context: CinematicNodeContext: speaking to Hope, across the room

RaphaelAppearance_94.speaker: Raphael
RaphaelAppearance_94.text: Korrilla - tell our unwelcome guest about your role in their tragic downfall.
RaphaelAppearance_94.context: CinematicNodeContext: turning to address Korrilla, close by his sideNodeContext: to a faithful warlock

RaphaelAppearance_30.speaker: Player
RaphaelAppearance_30.text: Korrilla - this is your chance to be free. Help me take him down.

RaphaelAppearance_90.speaker: Korrilla
RaphaelAppearance_90.text: You think I'm on your side?

RaphaelAppearance_57.speaker: Korrilla
RaphaelAppearance_57.text: The only reason you're here is because Raphael allowed you to be.

RaphaelAppearance_83.speaker: Player
RaphaelAppearance_83.text: It's over, Raphael. You can't stop me.

RaphaelAppearance_28.speaker: Hope
RaphaelAppearance_28.text: I AM NOT ENTIRELY SURE THAT HE WON'T

RaphaelAppearance_2.speaker: Player
RaphaelAppearance_2.text: Let me leave. There doesn't need to be any more bloodshed.

RaphaelAppearance_11.speaker: Raphael
RaphaelAppearance_11.text: You've given me no other choice. I offered you liberty, and you've chosen death.

AD_DeadSkeleton02_0.speaker: Narrator
AD_DeadSkeleton02_0.text: *Perhaps this dinner wasn't to their liking.*

AD_Raphael_Combat_05_0.speaker: Raphael
AD_Raphael_Combat_05_0.text: More souls. More ways to end you.

AD_Raphael_Combat_HopeDied_0.speaker: Raphael
AD_Raphael_Combat_HopeDied_0.context: NodeContext: commenting on the death of the character, hope

AD_PrisonSkeleton03_0.speaker: Narrator
AD_PrisonSkeleton03_0.text: *This one's suffering is forever enshrined in the harrowing arrangement of its bones.*

AD_DamnedSoul09_0.speaker: Errant Soul
AD_DamnedSoul09_0.context: NodeContext: pleased - like a teacher's pet while the teacher is out of class. The teacher in this case is Raphael.

ArchivistTrappedComment_0.speaker: Archivist
ArchivistTrappedComment_0.text: Lay a finger on the master's treasures, and you will lose the entire hand.
ArchivistTrappedComment_0.context: NodeContext: Calm, matter of fact warning

AD_ChamberPot_0.speaker: Narrator
AD_ChamberPot_0.text: *An overpowering stench singes your nostrils. Nothing good happened here.*

AD_SoulPillar01_0.speaker: Narrator
AD_SoulPillar01_0.text: *A chill emanates from the pillar, and you sense the sorrow of a thousand damned souls trapped within.*

AD_SoulPillar01_1.speaker: Narrator
AD_SoulPillar01_1.text: *The surface of the pillar is cool. Unnaturally so, given the heat of Avernus.*

AD_Raphael_Plaque4_0.speaker: Narrator
AD_Raphael_Plaque4_0.text: *Let your heart be glad, let your tongue rejoice, and let your soul rest forever in this House of Hope.*

ImpDebtor03_3.speaker: Voyeur Eternal Debtor
ImpDebtor03_3.text: You belong in there - in the boudoir. You should never leave.

ImpDebtor03_6.speaker: Voyeur Eternal Debtor
ImpDebtor03_6.text: I like to watch the door to the boudoir. I like to see who goes in. Who comes back out. And who never does.

ImpDebtor03_2.speaker: Player
ImpDebtor03_2.text: Does Raphael mind your watching his comings and goings?

ImpDebtor03_7.speaker: Voyeur Eternal Debtor
ImpDebtor03_7.text: Why, it was his idea. Here I watch, forever and forever. I can never join in. But I'll always look.

ImpDebtor03_4.speaker: Player
ImpDebtor03_4.text: Do you know what goes on inside that room?

ImpDebtor03_1.speaker: Voyeur Eternal Debtor
ImpDebtor03_1.text: Heehee. I like to peep through the keyhole. There's so much to see, so much to see...

PAD_FoyerBalcony_0.speaker: Player
PAD_FoyerBalcony_0.context: NodeContext: Karlach: To herself, looking at the Hells in disgust

AD_PortalMephistar_0.speaker: Narrator
AD_PortalMephistar_0.text: *Hellish ice chills this portal to Mephistar.*

AD_PortalMephistar_1.speaker: Narrator
AD_PortalMephistar_1.text: *This portal leads directly to the frigid citadel of Mephistar, nestled in the Hells.*

AD_HellsTelescope_0.speaker: Narrator
AD_HellsTelescope_0.text: *Through the telescope, a sinister vista sprawls before you - boiling rivers and sheer crags. A sight of the Hells that you'll never forget.*

AD_PortalAthkatla_1.speaker: Narrator
AD_PortalAthkatla_1.text: *The splendid city of Athkatla hums beyond the portal.*

AD_DamnedSoul05_0.speaker: Errant Soul
AD_DamnedSoul05_0.text: You shouldn't be here. None of us should.
AD_DamnedSoul05_0.context: NodeContext: quietly threatening, watching an intruder but unable to take action because he is little more than a ghost

Incubus_SpeakWithDead_20.speaker: Narrator
Incubus_SpeakWithDead_20.text: *The corpse does not stir. It will answer no more questions.*

Incubus_SpeakWithDead_17.speaker: Player
Incubus_SpeakWithDead_17.text: How did you end up here?

Incubus_SpeakWithDead_23.speaker: Haarlep
Incubus_SpeakWithDead_23.text: Sent by Mephistopheles... distract naughty son.

Incubus_SpeakWithDead_1.speaker: Player
Incubus_SpeakWithDead_1.text: Did Raphael prefer to be on top or beneath you?

Incubus_SpeakWithDead_0.speaker: Player
Incubus_SpeakWithDead_0.text: How do I reach the Orphic Hammer?

Incubus_SpeakWithDead_5.speaker: Player
Incubus_SpeakWithDead_5.text: How do I get my contract?

Incubus_SpeakWithDead_12.speaker: Player
Incubus_SpeakWithDead_12.text: Where does Raphael keep his secrets?

Incubus_SpeakWithDead_7.speaker: Player
Incubus_SpeakWithDead_7.text: Did you ever turn into forms besides Raphael's?

Incubus_SpeakWithDead_6.speaker: Player
Incubus_SpeakWithDead_6.text: Does Raphael have any weaknesses in battle?

Incubus_SpeakWithDead_3.speaker: Narrator
Incubus_SpeakWithDead_3.text: *The corpse remains silent. It does not know.*

Incubus_SpeakWithDead_24.speaker: Narrator
Incubus_SpeakWithDead_24.text: *The spell's power wanes. You can ask no more questions.*

Incubus_SpeakWithDead_26.speaker: Narrator
Incubus_SpeakWithDead_26.text: *The corpse seems willing to speak - but not to its killer.*

PAD_PortalMephistar_0.speaker: Player
PAD_PortalMephistar_0.text: Mephistar, home to the archdevil Mephistopheles. Raphael's bold indeed if he ever visits uninvited.

AD_Raphael_Plaque8_0.speaker: Narrator
AD_Raphael_Plaque8_0.text: *I am the architect of destiny, I am the purveyor of hope. I am the future.*

AD_DamnedSoul12_0.speaker: Errant Soul
AD_DamnedSoul12_0.text: I laughed in life I cry in death, a wicked shadow stole my breath.
AD_DamnedSoul12_0.context: NodeContext: sing-song, barely above a whisper, sad, solemn

PAD_PortalAthkatla_0.speaker: Player
PAD_PortalAthkatla_0.text: Athkatla, City of Coin, capital of Amn. They say the streets are paved with gold.

AD_DamnedSoul04_0.speaker: Errant Soul
AD_DamnedSoul04_0.context: NodeContext: eerily serene, little more than a whisper

AD_Raphael_Combat_HealthStolen_0.speaker: Raphael
AD_Raphael_Combat_HealthStolen_0.context: NodeContext: sadistic, during combat as he siphons off somebody's life force

Incubus_BodyGivenFollowup_27.speaker: Narrator
Incubus_BodyGivenFollowup_27.text: *A single shiver. A feeling barely perceptible, but you can sense it nonetheless. A phantom caress, hands dancing over your skin.*

Incubus_BodyGivenFollowup_40.speaker: Narrator
Incubus_BodyGivenFollowup_40.text: *Though you stand alone, it is almost as if the air itself is undressing you.*

Incubus_BodyGivenFollowup_0.speaker: Narrator
Incubus_BodyGivenFollowup_0.text: *You recall Haarlep's words: 'Every time I make love in your shape, you will know. You will know.'*

Incubus_BodyGivenFollowup_36.speaker: Narrator
Incubus_BodyGivenFollowup_36.text: *As a blushing flush runs through you, you rejoice, anticipating all the pleasures you will feel, without the world knowing.*

Incubus_BodyGivenFollowup_42.speaker: Player
Incubus_BodyGivenFollowup_42.text: Stifle the moan that seeks to escape you.

Incubus_BodyGivenFollowup_26.speaker: Astarion
Incubus_BodyGivenFollowup_26.text: I heard that moan. It's the incubus, isn't it? Enjoying your body?

Incubus_BodyGivenFollowup_31.speaker: Astarion
Incubus_BodyGivenFollowup_31.text: Just as I get free from bondage, you fall into it. It'd be funny if it was anyone but you, my love.

Incubus_BodyGivenFollowup_13.speaker: Astarion
Incubus_BodyGivenFollowup_13.text: I know what it's like to lose control over your own body. It's a wretched thing.

Incubus_BodyGivenFollowup_37.speaker: Player
Incubus_BodyGivenFollowup_37.text: I hope Haarlep gets bored of turning into me after a while.

Incubus_BodyGivenFollowup_10.speaker: Astarion
Incubus_BodyGivenFollowup_10.text: True, infernal creatures can be fickle. Let's hope he gets bored.

Incubus_BodyGivenFollowup_3.speaker: Astarion
Incubus_BodyGivenFollowup_3.text: I can't imagine getting bored of all that myself, but you never know.
Incubus_BodyGivenFollowup_3.context: NodeContext: Referring to the player's rockin' body (this line appears if Astarion is in a relationship with you)

Incubus_BodyGivenFollowup_41.speaker: Astarion
Incubus_BodyGivenFollowup_41.text: I know what's done is done - you made your vow. But I'm sorry all the same.

Incubus_BodyGivenFollowup_33.speaker: Player
Incubus_BodyGivenFollowup_33.text: I may as well just try to enjoy it.

Incubus_BodyGivenFollowup_38.speaker: Astarion
Incubus_BodyGivenFollowup_38.text: I thought the same, once. It didn't last.

Incubus_BodyGivenFollowup_21.speaker: Player
Incubus_BodyGivenFollowup_21.text: It's not so bad. I can put up with it.

Incubus_BodyGivenFollowup_20.speaker: Astarion
Incubus_BodyGivenFollowup_20.text: That's not the point - you shouldn't have to 'put up with it'.

Incubus_BodyGivenFollowup_29.speaker: Player
Incubus_BodyGivenFollowup_29.text: Unlike you to care all of a sudden.

Incubus_BodyGivenFollowup_12.speaker: Astarion
Incubus_BodyGivenFollowup_12.text: It's just a little friendly advice: don't underestimate how this curse will get to your head, in time.

Incubus_BodyGivenFollowup_43.speaker: Astarion
Incubus_BodyGivenFollowup_43.text: Gods, though I've become untouchable, my precious treasure has been violated still.

Incubus_BodyGivenFollowup_17.speaker: Lae'zel
Incubus_BodyGivenFollowup_17.text: Indeed? I wouldn't dare deny you your self-pleasures. But do clean up after yourself.

Incubus_BodyGivenFollowup_23.speaker: Shadowheart
Incubus_BodyGivenFollowup_23.text: My. You must find the city very appealing to be making those sorts of noises out in public...

Incubus_BodyGivenFollowup_18.speaker: Wyll
Incubus_BodyGivenFollowup_18.text: Well. If you must indulge, might I suggest some place more secluded next time?

Incubus_BodyGivenFollowup_24.speaker: Gale
Incubus_BodyGivenFollowup_24.text: If you must indulge yourself like that, please do it quietly.

Incubus_BodyGivenFollowup_14.speaker: Karlach
Incubus_BodyGivenFollowup_14.context: NodeContext: Wince in repulsion. Listening to the player moan.

Incubus_BodyGivenFollowup_39.speaker: Halsin
Incubus_BodyGivenFollowup_39.text: Normally such sounds would be most welcome, but perhaps not right now...

Incubus_BodyGivenFollowup_5.speaker: Jaheira
Incubus_BodyGivenFollowup_5.text: Well, let us hope you cannot catch anything this way.
Incubus_BodyGivenFollowup_5.context: NodeContext: Has just heard the avatar make a sexual moan out of the blue, in public, from the incubus' curse. Snort of suppressed amusement - player chose this, and is paying for it now.

Incubus_BodyGivenFollowup_34.speaker: Minsc
Incubus_BodyGivenFollowup_34.text: My friend? Are you hurt? Show us where you are wounded, so that we might help!
Incubus_BodyGivenFollowup_34.context: NodeContext: Has just heard the avatar make a sexual moan out of the blue, in public, from the incubus' curse. Oblivious and genuinely concerned.

Incubus_BodyGivenFollowup_6.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
Incubus_BodyGivenFollowup_6.text: Have you no dignity? Control yourself.

Incubus_BodyGivenFollowup_7.speaker: Player
Incubus_BodyGivenFollowup_7.text: Try to ignore it and move on.

Incubus_BodyGivenFollowup_25.speaker: Narrator
Incubus_BodyGivenFollowup_25.text: *One last tingle up your spine leads to a stifled moan, you struggle not to cry out in public.*

Incubus_BodyGivenFollowup_16.speaker: Narrator
Incubus_BodyGivenFollowup_16.text: *The sensation goes. But it could return at any point. How many hundreds of times will Haarlep use your person?*

FireDebtor01_1.speaker: Smouldering Eternal Debtor
FireDebtor01_1.text: My blood... it's burning. Sizzling. Do you feel it? Don't come too close.

FireDebtor01_0.speaker: Smouldering Eternal Debtor
FireDebtor01_0.text: My bones are kindling. Soon they'll catch light.

FireDebtor01_2.speaker: Smouldering Eternal Debtor
FireDebtor01_2.text: Don't look. Don't look or it'll spark. Ignite! Burn me inside to outside until I'm bloody ash and paste. Don't breathe me in!

ImpDebtor02_0.speaker: Visionary Eternal Debtor
ImpDebtor02_0.text: Can you see with eye pieces? Can you cry? Can the jellied gouts be whole again? I want to know. I want to see.
ImpDebtor02_0.context: NodeContext: Delirious/mounting fervour as the line continues

ImpDebtor02_1.speaker: Visionary Eternal Debtor
ImpDebtor02_1.text: He said he'd turn my eyes in on themselves. To see inside me. Rolling and rolling until they burst.
ImpDebtor02_1.context: NodeContext: Delirious/mounting fervour as the line continues

AD_Raphael_Plaque5_0.speaker: Narrator
AD_Raphael_Plaque5_0.text: *There is but one law, and it is immutable - I am that law.*

Mason_50.speaker: Infernal Mason
Mason_50.text: A builder. A creator. A saviour.

Mason_62.speaker: Infernal Mason
Mason_62.text: But at my foundation, I am a lost soul. We share that foundation.

Mason_76.speaker: Player
Mason_76.text: Unless I'm mistaken, we've never met.

Mason_8.speaker: Infernal Mason
Mason_8.text: I know you nonetheless. Not by name, not by reputation.

Mason_1.speaker: Infernal Mason
Mason_1.text: As the steeple knows the arch, and the keystone knows the clay, I know you, for we are both parts of the same design.

Mason_95.speaker: Infernal Mason
Mason_95.text: Like me, you made a deal with the devil, and authored your own damnable fate for the greater good.

Mason_5.speaker: Player
Mason_5.text: What greater good did you sell your soul for?

Mason_85.speaker: Infernal Mason
Mason_85.text: Alas, it was a good that never came to be.

Mason_19.speaker: Infernal Mason
Mason_19.text: I was an architect in life, a builder of tombs and temples, but mostly of towers. My proudest work reached for the stars and sought to dry Selûne's tears.

Mason_20.speaker: Infernal Mason
Mason_20.text: It was a monument to life and to virtue, and a happy home to my master for many years.

Mason_36.speaker: Player
Mason_36.text: Just as the moon wanes, Selûne's blessings always fade.

Mason_23.speaker: Infernal Mason
Mason_23.text: I wish I could say it were not so.

Mason_44.speaker: Infernal Mason
Mason_44.text: When tragedy came, my master fell into darkness and despair.

Mason_32.speaker: Infernal Mason
Mason_32.text: He marshalled a great army to ruin the world and bring all into shadow. I could not let it happen.

Mason_49.speaker: Infernal Mason
Mason_49.text: I sought out the devil Raphael and signed an infernal pact with him. He promised to destroy my master's army, and I promised him my soul in return.

Mason_12.speaker: Infernal Mason
Mason_12.text: The devil was true to his word. Fiends slaughtered my master's forces, but he endured somehow, and blighted the land.

Mason_89.speaker: Player
Mason_89.text: This is a familiar tale. Are you the architect of Moonrise Towers?

Mason_14.speaker: Infernal Mason
Mason_14.text: You know my work? I am glad that it endures. Perhaps you also have the misfortune of knowing my master - general Ketheric Thorm.

Mason_64.speaker: Player
Mason_64.text: Ketheric is no more. I killed him.

Mason_87.speaker: Infernal Mason
Mason_87.text: Then all came to pass as I had hoped, though a century too late for my family and friends.

Mason_56.speaker: Infernal Mason
Mason_56.text: Your actions may have justified the price of my soul. I thank you.

Mason_81.speaker: Infernal Mason
Mason_81.text: Tell me - what became of my pride? What became of Moonrise Towers?

Mason_3.speaker: Player
Mason_3.text: We restored the spirit of the land around Moonrise. Nature is healing, and the tower can yet be restored to glory.

Mason_25.speaker: Player
Mason_25.text: Moonrise is an affront to nature. It should be destroyed.

Mason_102.speaker: Player
Mason_102.text: The tower still stands, but it is a hollow place now.

Mason_99.speaker: Infernal Mason
Mason_99.text: Perhaps one day, new life will find it. Thank you.

Mason_65.speaker: Infernal Mason
Mason_65.text: Now, go. Finish your business here, and leave while you can.

Mason_98.speaker: Player
Mason_98.text: Sadly, the curse still grips the tower, and the lands around it.

Mason_31.speaker: Infernal Mason
Mason_31.text: Perhaps it will fade into a long night and be forgotten, as I have. Perhaps that is for the best.

Mason_57.speaker: Player
Mason_57.text: Moonrise is a cursed place - your legacy is in ruins.

Mason_68.speaker: Infernal Mason
Mason_68.text: All towers fall in the end. Thorm is vanquished - that was my purpose.

Mason_70.speaker: Infernal Mason
Mason_70.text: Perhaps it is best that I remain here, and that the long centuries erode my memories and leave me empty. There is a certain peace in that.

Mason_21.speaker: Player
Mason_21.text: We healed the land and lifted the shadow curse. Moonrise will be a beacon of light again.

Mason_17.speaker: Infernal Mason
Mason_17.text: I did not think it possible. Thank you - my spirit smiles for the first time in a century.

Mason_28.speaker: Player
Mason_28.text: The curse is no more, but Moonrise is tainted. It would be best reduced to rubble.

Mason_90.speaker: Player
Mason_90.text: Your intervention pushed Ketheric deeper into darkness. He became a Chosen of Myrkul.

Mason_71.speaker: Infernal Mason
Mason_71.text: Then my pact, the loss of my eternal soul... it was all for nothing.

Mason_29.speaker: Player
Mason_29.text: Not quite. Ketheric Thorm is dead, by my hand.

Mason_33.speaker: Player
Mason_33.text: Dealing with devils never ends well.

Mason_40.speaker: Infernal Mason
Mason_40.text: And yet here you are, having made the same mistake. Find your contract, and undo it if you can.

Mason_58.speaker: Infernal Mason
Mason_58.text: You may be right, but those who live in desperate times often reach for desperate solutions. Be sure not to do the same.

Mason_37.speaker: Infernal Mason
Mason_37.text: Finish what business brought you here as quickly as possible, and then leave. Otherwise, you will be lost, like the rest of us.

Mason_82.speaker: Player
Mason_82.text: Dealing with devils rarely ends well - I speak from extensive experience.

Mason_101.speaker: Infernal Mason
Mason_101.text: Whatever mistakes you have made in the past, your deal with Raphael can still be undone. Find your contract, and then leave while you can.

Mason_96.speaker: Infernal Mason
Mason_96.text: Those who live in desperate times often reach for desperate solutions. I fear we have both lived in such times, but there is still hope for you.

Mason_6.speaker: Player
Mason_6.text: Pacts have great value. If yours did not, you were careless in making it.

Mason_60.speaker: Player
Mason_60.text: By my oath, I did what the fiends could not, and vanquished Ketheric Thorm.

Mason_47.speaker: Player
Mason_47.text: A life with Our Lady of Silver is a good life.

Mason_80.speaker: Infernal Mason
Mason_80.text: It was a good life. I only wish our Lady had not averted her gaze from us.

Mason_46.speaker: Infernal Mason
Mason_46.text: Deaths in the family. Happiness rarely lasts a lifetime.

Mason_30.speaker: Infernal Mason
Mason_30.text: A great general, a greater man. Ketheric Thorm.

Mason_55.speaker: Player
Mason_55.text: I don't have time for this - I came here to find my contract.

Mason_100.speaker: Infernal Mason
Mason_100.text: You are right to hurry. My sorrows will only burden you.

Mason_67.speaker: Infernal Mason
Mason_67.text: Now go, find your contract and save your soul.

Mason_73.speaker: Infernal Mason
Mason_73.text: Perhaps you should seek out the Archive...

Mason_34.speaker: Infernal Mason
Mason_34.text: But beware, the House is architecturally unstable. Left is sometimes right, but more often it is wrong.

Mason_22.speaker: Player
Mason_22.text: I don't have time for this. I came here to find the Orphic Hammer.

Mason_63.speaker: Player
Mason_63.text: How do you know about my deal?

Mason_42.speaker: Infernal Mason
Mason_42.text: There is a stamp on your soul, as distinct as a mason's mark. Raphael owns you, just as he owns me.

Mason_27.speaker: Player
Mason_27.text: I need to find my contract to break the deal I made.

Mason_84.speaker: Infernal Mason
Mason_84.text: Can you be sure that breaking the deal will do more good than harm?

Mason_16.speaker: Player
Mason_16.text: Yes, I already have what I needed from Raphael.

Mason_92.speaker: Infernal Mason
Mason_92.text: Then I hope you find your contract and free yourself, but I fear for you. This is a dangerous place.

Mason_74.speaker: Player
Mason_74.text: My soul hangs in the balance - that's all I care about.

Mason_91.speaker: Player
Mason_91.text: No. I made the deal to help save Baldur's Gate.

Mason_94.speaker: Infernal Mason
Mason_94.text: Then perhaps the greater good would be to leave this House, and to abide by the terms of your deal.

Mason_86.speaker: Player
Mason_86.text: I'm not leaving until I find my contract.

Mason_54.speaker: Player
Mason_54.text: Tell me about the deal you signed.

Mason_39.speaker: Infernal Mason
Mason_39.text: You linger here still? Or perhaps you have become lost, like the rest of us.

Mason_51.speaker: Infernal Mason
Mason_51.text: Another sorry soul come to wander these halls. What do you seek?

Mason_75.speaker: Player
Mason_75.text: What ties you to the House of Hope?

Mason_72.speaker: Player
Mason_72.text: Tell me what you know of this place.

Mason_43.speaker: Infernal Mason
Mason_43.text: Despite appearances, this whole House is more of a prison than a parlour. Most here have no choice but to remain.

Mason_88.speaker: Infernal Mason
Mason_88.text: I am one such. This is not my home, but I can never leave.

Mason_61.speaker: Player
Mason_61.text: I need to find the Archive.

Mason_9.speaker: Player
Mason_9.text: I'm looking for the Orphic Hammer.

Mason_41.speaker: Infernal Mason
Mason_41.text: It is easy to look for a thing. It is impossible to take it.

Mason_59.speaker: Infernal Mason
Mason_59.text: I cannot help you. This is not my home, even if I can never leave.

Mason_24.speaker: Player
Mason_24.text: Do you know Hope? I spoke to her a moment ago.

Mason_66.speaker: Infernal Mason
Mason_66.text: She will find you when you need her. That is Hope's way.

AD_DamnedSoul08_0.speaker: Errant Soul
AD_DamnedSoul08_0.context: NodeContext: quietly sinister - trying to be flattering, but it's a disembodied spirit so this comes across as creepy

AD_PrisonSkeleton02_0.speaker: Narrator
AD_PrisonSkeleton02_0.text: *Tortured to death, or starved? In any case, definitely dead.*

PAD_SoulPillar_0.speaker: Player
PAD_SoulPillar_0.text: Odd statue. Probably cost an arm and a leg - or worse, considering it's Raphael's.

PAD_SoulPillar_1.speaker: Player
PAD_SoulPillar_1.text: Something's wrong here. Devilish magic of some kind.

PAD_PortalNeverwinter_0.speaker: Player
PAD_PortalNeverwinter_0.text: Neverwinter, Jewel of the North. I wonder if the cult of the Absolute has influence there as well.

AD_Raphael_Combat_04_0.speaker: Raphael
AD_Raphael_Combat_04_0.text: I'd spend every soul to eradicate you.

AD_Raphael_Combat_SoulIsBack_0.speaker: Raphael
AD_Raphael_Combat_SoulIsBack_0.text: Fight, struggle, beg. It'll make no difference.
AD_Raphael_Combat_SoulIsBack_0.context: NodeContext: during combat, annoyed but arrogant

AD_DeadSkeleton03_0.speaker: Narrator
AD_DeadSkeleton03_0.text: *A delicious aroma still lingers around the table - your mouth waters, just a little.*

HopeSpirit_Prison_38.text: Careful. The jailor will swallow you whole if you take another step.
HopeSpirit_Prison_38.context: NodeContext: quietly, warning in hushed tones

HopeSpirit_Prison_3.text: AND YOU WON'T BE ABLE TO SAVE ME WHILE YOU'RE BEING DIGESTED

HopeSpirit_Prison_44.text: You found my prison. My body is held in chains just beyond.
HopeSpirit_Prison_44.context: NodeContext: composing herself after outburst on previous node, calmly explaining the situation

HopeSpirit_Prison_57.text: BUT YOUR MEAT IS COOKED YOUR SOUL IS SCORCHED AND YOUR RACE IS RUN
HopeSpirit_Prison_57.context: NodeContext: happy outburst, enjoying the patterns of the language despite the dire news they contain

HopeSpirit_Prison_0.text: RAPHAEL IS STRIDING ACROSS THE PLANES CHASING THE BEAT OF YOUR TERRIFIED HEART
HopeSpirit_Prison_0.context: NodeContext: dramatic, enjoying the intensity of the situation despite its dangers

HopeSpirit_Prison_31.text: He still has your contract. And while he does, you have approximately zero ways of surviving an encounter with him.
HopeSpirit_Prison_31.context: NodeContext: composing herself and trying to make this sound less dire than it is

HopeSpirit_Prison_52.text: You'll have to find it, lickety-split, right after you free me.
HopeSpirit_Prison_52.context: NodeContext: cheerful despite the dire situation

HopeSpirit_Prison_17.text: And you have precisely zero ways of breaking me out of my chains.
HopeSpirit_Prison_17.context: NodeContext: cheerful despite the dire situation

HopeSpirit_Prison_34.text: DID YOU EXPECT TO BREAK THEM WITH YOUR THICK SKULL?
HopeSpirit_Prison_34.context: NodeContext: panicked outburst, incredulous at player's stupidity

HopeSpirit_Prison_54.text: BUT WHERE IS YOUR CONTRACT YOU INGLORIOUS LUMP
HopeSpirit_Prison_54.context: NodeContext: outburst, insulting the player but only because she's frustrated

HopeSpirit_Prison_4.text: Presumably, you intend to chew through the chains, cracking your teeth like eggshells.
HopeSpirit_Prison_4.context: NodeContext: not sarcastic - she genuinely believes this is what the player plans to do, ludicrous as it is

HopeSpirit_Prison_22.text: It won't work! The Hammer is the only thing capable of shattering the chains.
HopeSpirit_Prison_22.context: NodeContext: first phrase is urgent, then she calms a little to deliver the info

HopeSpirit_Prison_23.text: NOT HERE YOU WON'T YOU BLUNDERING CRICKET

HopeSpirit_Prison_58.context: NodeContext: composing herself after an outburst and delivering a clear instruction, calmly

HopeSpirit_Prison_65.text: When you remove it, the whole House will go up in flames.

HopeSpirit_Prison_78.text: Yes it is. And when you remove it, the whole House will go up in flames.

HopeSpirit_Prison_73.text: And Raphael will fly home furious.
HopeSpirit_Prison_73.context: NodeContext: mostly calm, but with a hint of dread. She's very scared of Raphael

HopeSpirit_Prison_68.speaker: Player
HopeSpirit_Prison_68.text: Why can't I just free you now?

HopeSpirit_Prison_42.text: The sound of the chains breaking will echo across the planes - Raphael will fly home furious when he hears it.
HopeSpirit_Prison_42.context: NodeContext: mostly calm, but with a hint of dread. She's very scared of Raphael

HopeSpirit_Prison_32.text: If he still has your contract when that happens, you're dead as dung.

HopeSpirit_Prison_74.text: READY FOR RAPHAEL'S HOMECOMING? HA! HE'LL USE YOU AS A HANDKERCHIEF
HopeSpirit_Prison_74.context: NodeContext: Quzizical and incredulous on first phrase (you can't possibly be ready for this, are you mad?). Forced, single 'ha'. Then the last phrase is a terrifying prospect

HopeSpirit_Prison_47.text: No, no, no, don't listen to me. You're going to do just fine. I'll be waiting.
HopeSpirit_Prison_47.context: NodeContext: composing herself and trying to be reassuring while clearly panicking

HopeSpirit_Prison_9.speaker: Player
HopeSpirit_Prison_9.text: This all sounds like more trouble than it's worth.

HopeSpirit_Prison_12.text: THEN RUN RUN RUN AS FAST AS YOU CAN

HopeSpirit_Prison_46.text: I'll still be here, hoping you change your mind.

HopeSpirit_Prison_53.speaker: Player
HopeSpirit_Prison_53.text: Freeing you is more trouble than it's worth.

HopeSpirit_Prison_29.text: Maybe that's why nobody has. I hoped you were different.

HopeSpirit_Prison_72.text: You really went and did it, didn't you?

HopeSpirit_Prison_55.text: The whole House is tumbling down, and Raphael's striding across the planes to come catch a mouse.
HopeSpirit_Prison_55.context: NodeContext: in awe of the incredibly dangerous situation she and the player are in

HopeSpirit_Prison_76.text: Now swing that big, beautiful Hammer, crack open my chains, and let's get out of here.

HopeSpirit_Prison_51.text: IT'S TIME TO FLY THIS COOP ON A HOPE AND A PRAYER
HopeSpirit_Prison_51.context: NodeContext: outburst of relief and joy

HopeSpirit_Prison_60.text: YOU SOUND SO BRAVE BUT WE REALLY DON'T HAVE A CHOICE

HopeSpirit_Prison_79.speaker: Player
HopeSpirit_Prison_79.text: Any advice when it comes to fighting Raphael?

HopeSpirit_Prison_8.text: But if you must, make sure I'm with you. He makes mistakes when he's angry, and seeing me running free will make him as angry as an axe-head.
HopeSpirit_Prison_8.context: NodeContext: composing herself and trying to

HopeSpirit_Prison_20.speaker: Player
HopeSpirit_Prison_20.text: I'm getting out of here without you.

HopeSpirit_Prison_10.context: NodeContext: flat, not enough energy to be emotional

HopeSpirit_Prison_56.text: I hope you manage to escape regardless. Goodbye, goodbye, goodbye, goodbye.
HopeSpirit_Prison_56.context: NodeContext: encouraging but sad, expecting this to be her final goodbye

HopeSpirit_Prison_36.text: I was rather hoping I'd be leaving with you rather than sizzling like a frog in a furnace.
HopeSpirit_Prison_36.context: NodeContext: sad, resigned to her fate

HopeSpirit_Prison_26.text: BUT DO YOU EXPECT TO SHATTER THE CHAINS WITH YOUR THICK SKULL?

HopeSpirit_Prison_43.text: Sorry, sorry, sorry. I'm sure your skull is lovely. I can't wait to see it. WITH ALL THE SKIN ATTACHED OF COURSE.
HopeSpirit_Prison_43.context: NodeContext: composing herself after an outburst and trying to placate the player. On final phrase she's afraid she's accidentally threatened them and is clarifying manically.

HopeSpirit_Prison_49.text: But you didn't bring the Hammer. It's the only thing that can break my chains.

HopeSpirit_Prison_1.speaker: Player
HopeSpirit_Prison_1.text: I have no idea where it is.

HopeSpirit_Prison_69.text: MY HEART IS SINKING LIKE A STORM-TOSSED SHIP

HopeSpirit_Prison_19.text: I don't think the Hammer is even on this plane of existence. That is quite a quandary.
HopeSpirit_Prison_19.context: NodeContext: composing herself as she sounds out the sheer impossibility of the situation

HopeSpirit_Prison_45.text: I TOLD YOU HOW IMPORTANT IT IS AT LEAST A MILLION TIMES

HopeSpirit_Prison_13.text: Retrace your steps all the way back to the cradle and your mother's womb if you have to. FIND THE HAMMER.
HopeSpirit_Prison_13.context: NodeContext: composing herself to try and give clear instructions that become increasingly deranged

HopeSpirit_Prison_63.text: You had it when you arrived, so go and find it.
HopeSpirit_Prison_63.context: NodeContext: composing herself to try and give clear instructions

HopeSpirit_Prison_5.speaker: Player
HopeSpirit_Prison_5.text: I will bring the Hammer. And we will be ready for Raphael.

SkeletonDebtor01_0.speaker: Librarian Eternal Debtor
SkeletonDebtor01_0.text: I cleanse the books. I comb each and every line for falsehoods and purge them pure.

SkeletonDebtor01_1.speaker: Librarian Eternal Debtor
SkeletonDebtor01_1.text: I will make them perfect! Pages crisp with lines and letters. I will make them beautiful for him, I promise. I promise.
SkeletonDebtor01_1.context: NodeContext: Impassioned and slightly panicky that his work won't be enough

AD_HopeCallsToTalk_0.context: NodeContext: meant as a genuine compliment - speaking to somebody who is disguised as a wretch

AD_HopeCallsToTalk_1.context: NodeContext: quietly drawing attention to herself, and then increasing volume on second phrase - she's not very good at containing her excitement

AD_HopeCallsToTalk_2.text: Phew. I thought you'd got lost and died.
AD_HopeCallsToTalk_2.context: NodeContext: relieved to see the player again

PAD_MagicKeyword_0.speaker: Player
PAD_MagicKeyword_0.text: A keyword - this'll help us get what we need from the Archive.

PAD_MagicKeyword_1.speaker: Player
PAD_MagicKeyword_1.text: A magic keyword. That'll help us in the Archive.

AD_ArchivistMainComment_0.speaker: Archivist
AD_ArchivistMainComment_0.text: I see the Orphic Hammer has caught your eye. It really is a magnificent exhibit. Wholly unique.
AD_ArchivistMainComment_0.context: NodeContext: Worried the player might steal

AD_ArchivistMainComment_1.speaker: Archivist
AD_ArchivistMainComment_1.text: Raphael has reserved this pedestal for the prize of his collection. It currently holds the contract of a rather unique soul.
AD_ArchivistMainComment_1.context: NodeContext: Slight awe (but worried the player might steal)

AD_PetrifiedDebtor2_0.speaker: Narrator
AD_PetrifiedDebtor2_0.text: *So close, and yet so far. All hope of escape frozen in time, forever.*

AD_PrisonDoorButtonCantUse_0.speaker: Narrator
AD_PrisonDoorButtonCantUse_0.text: *The mechanism is locked, and can't be used again.*

AD_DamnedSoul03_0.speaker: Errant Soul
AD_DamnedSoul03_0.context: NodeContext: barely more than a whisper, afraid, is ceasing to exist

AD_DamnedSoul15_0.speaker: Errant Soul
AD_DamnedSoul15_0.text: Do I know you? Were we happy once?

TreasureBlocker_17.speaker: Narrator
TreasureBlocker_17.text: *That which you seek is still so close, yet so far.*

TreasureBlocker_18.speaker: Narrator
TreasureBlocker_18.text: *There it is: Your contract with Raphael, your signature bold at the bottom. The earthy smell of fresh ink still lingers.*

TreasureBlocker_15.speaker: Narrator
TreasureBlocker_15.text: *A magical field surrounds the item, preventing you - or anyone - from touching it. You surmise it's controlled by a vocal component: magic words.*

TreasureBlocker_40.speaker: Lae'zel
TreasureBlocker_40.text: You know the words. Now speak them.

TreasureBlocker_9.speaker: Lae'zel
TreasureBlocker_9.text: This is not over. There is no lock that cannot be undone.

TreasureBlocker_7.speaker: Lae'zel
TreasureBlocker_7.text: We take the Hammer and break Orpheus free. The traitor prince will perish by my hand.

TreasureBlocker_16.speaker: Player
TreasureBlocker_16.text: Reach out to sense how far you can reach before being repelled.

TreasureBlocker_37.speaker: Narrator
TreasureBlocker_37.text: *Before you can reach out, a compulsion in your head stops you. 'NO,' it seems to say.*

TreasureBlocker_36.speaker: Player
TreasureBlocker_36.text: It is I, Raphael. Lower your defences.

TreasureBlocker_0.speaker: Player
TreasureBlocker_0.text: Speak the magic words: 'Give me my heart's desire.'

TreasureBlocker_42.speaker: Narrator
TreasureBlocker_42.text: *The magic blinks away at your words.*
TreasureBlocker_42.context: CinematicNodeContext: Magic covering the items vanishes.

TreasureBlocker_12.speaker: Lae'zel
TreasureBlocker_12.text: Be ready. A devil does not so readily give up his toys.
TreasureBlocker_12.context: InternalNodeContext: On the pedestal, depending on the flow, there is either Orphic Hammer or contract. To avoid making two alternative nodes we should have something vague that will work with both

TreasureBlocker_25.speaker: Shadowheart
TreasureBlocker_25.text: Careful. Stealing the most precious item in this place is hardly going to go unnoticed...
TreasureBlocker_25.context: InternalNodeContext: On the pedestal, depending on the flow, there is either Orphic Hammer or contract. To avoid making two alternative nodes we should have something vague that will work with both

TreasureBlocker_33.speaker: Astarion
TreasureBlocker_33.text: I'm all for thieving, but let's not be hasty. Steal this and the devil will notice.
TreasureBlocker_33.context: InternalNodeContext: On the pedestal, depending on the flow, there is either Orphic Hammer or contract. To avoid making two alternative nodes we should have something vague that will work with both

TreasureBlocker_19.speaker: Wyll
TreasureBlocker_19.text: Ready yourself. Raphael won't give up his treasure without a fight.
TreasureBlocker_19.context: InternalNodeContext: On the pedestal, depending on the flow, there is either Orphic Hammer or contract. To avoid making two alternative nodes we should have something vague that will work with both

TreasureBlocker_27.speaker: Gale
TreasureBlocker_27.text: Might I suggest that was a little too easy? Steal this, and we should brace ourselves for what comes next. I fear the hells will truly let loose.
TreasureBlocker_27.context: InternalNodeContext: On the pedestal, depending on the flow, there is either Orphic Hammer or contract. To avoid making two alternative nodes we should have something vague that will work with both

TreasureBlocker_10.speaker: Karlach
TreasureBlocker_10.text: Careful now. Last thing we want to do is call forth Raphael's ugly mug before we need to.
TreasureBlocker_10.context: InternalNodeContext: On the pedestal, depending on the flow, there is either Orphic Hammer or contract. To avoid making two alternative nodes we should have something vague that will work with both

TreasureBlocker_41.speaker: Halsin
TreasureBlocker_41.text: Careful. The theft of the most important item in this place will surely not go unnoticed.
TreasureBlocker_41.context: InternalNodeContext: On the pedestal, depending on the flow, there is either Orphic Hammer or contract. To avoid making two alternative nodes we should have something vague that will work with both

TreasureBlocker_2.speaker: Jaheira
TreasureBlocker_2.text: Be ready. I suspect Raphael will throws a tantrum when the other children touch his toys.
TreasureBlocker_2.context: InternalNodeContext: On the pedestal, depending on the flow, there is either Orphic Hammer or contract. To avoid making two alternative nodes we should have something vague that will work with both

TreasureBlocker_34.speaker: Minsc
TreasureBlocker_34.text: Careful! No matter how stealthy you are, a squirrel will always know when you have stolen his nuts. Boo has learned this, at great cost.
TreasureBlocker_34.context: InternalNodeContext: On the pedestal, depending on the flow, there is either Orphic Hammer or contract. To avoid making two alternative nodes we should have something vague that will work with both

TreasureBlocker_3.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
TreasureBlocker_3.text: Are we prepared for Raphael's fury? We will survive the hells through strategy, not strength.
TreasureBlocker_3.context: InternalNodeContext: On the pedestal, depending on the flow, there is either Orphic Hammer or contract. To avoid making two alternative nodes we should have something vague that will work with both

TreasureBlocker_24.speaker: Narrator
TreasureBlocker_24.text: *The Orphic Hammer is within reach. But your theft won't go unnoticed.*

TreasureBlocker_20.speaker: Narrator
TreasureBlocker_20.text: *Your contract is within reach. But your theft won't go unnoticed.*

TreasureBlocker_28.speaker: Narrator
TreasureBlocker_28.text: *It appears to be protected by an energy field of some kind, but you're not familiar with this magic.*

TreasureBlocker_30.speaker: Narrator
TreasureBlocker_30.text: *There it is - the Orphic Hammer. Right within reach.*

TreasureBlocker_39.speaker: Narrator
TreasureBlocker_39.text: *An ornate hammer hovers above the pedestal.*

TreasureBlocker_26.speaker: Narrator
TreasureBlocker_26.text: *There is an inscription on the pedestal: 'When the Orphic Hammer strikes like thunder, even Astral chains are torn asunder.'*

TreasureBlocker_6.speaker: Lae'zel
TreasureBlocker_6.text: What? This hammer can free Orpheus from his astral prison. Take it -

TreasureBlocker_11.speaker: Narrator
TreasureBlocker_11.text: *If the inscription is accurate, this hammer may be the key to breaking Orpheus free.*

AD_RescueHope_0.speaker: Hope
AD_RescueHope_0.text: I understand that this is a high pressure situation, and I don't want to throw around accusations.
AD_RescueHope_0.context: NodeContext: as if about to lecture a child who made a mess

AD_RescueHope_2.speaker: Hope
AD_RescueHope_2.text: BUT WHERE IS THE HAMMER YOU TREMENDOUS DOLT?

AD_RescueHope_1.speaker: Hope
AD_RescueHope_1.text: That Hammer is almost as sweet a sight as you are.

Archivist_22.speaker: Archivist
Archivist_22.text: This is delightful. You have what you wanted, but you cannot leave lest all hells break loose.
Archivist_22.context: NodeContext: dripping with sarcasm and rising mania - delivered to somebody who stole from him and is about to die

Archivist_9.speaker: Archivist
Archivist_9.text: Ha ha. Ha ha ha! A ho-ho-hopeless situation. Ha ha ha ha ha!
Archivist_9.context: NodeContext: trying to stifle laughter at first, then making the intentional 'ho ho ho' into hopeless joke before laughing manically and uncontrollably

Archivist_39.speaker: Archivist
Archivist_39.text: You claimed to be who you are not, stole from my master, and now you expect to leave?

Archivist_5.speaker: Archivist
Archivist_5.text: The moment you step outside this room, all hells will break loose.
Archivist_5.context: NodeContext: dripping with sarcasm and rising mania - delivered to somebody who stole from him and is about to die

Archivist_49.speaker: Archivist
Archivist_49.text: Dishevelled and with a lingering odour of blood and sweat. I hope you found the boudoir to your liking.

Archivist_55.speaker: Archivist
Archivist_55.text: The master will deal with you when he returns. And I'll mop up whatever remains.
Archivist_55.context: NodeContext: not angry, just dismissive. Wants us gone

Archivist_56.speaker: Archivist
Archivist_56.text: Not a limb out of place. Either you haven't visited the boudoir yet, or you're more robust than you look.
Archivist_56.context: NodeContext: appraising player politely, mildly surprised to see them again

Archivist_59.speaker: Archivist
Archivist_59.text: Splendid to see you again, Inquisitor.

Archivist_66.speaker: Archivist
Archivist_66.text: A guest? Are you a client of the master, or a visitor from elsewhere in the Hells?
Archivist_66.context: NodeContext: Inquisitive, thoughtful, eyeing up a visitor suspiciously

Archivist_73.speaker: Archivist
Archivist_73.text: I do not believe you were invited. One moment - I shall consult the visitors' schedule.
Archivist_73.context: NodeContext: irritated. The schedule is not a physical object - it's kept in his mind.

Archivist_133.speaker: Archivist
Archivist_133.context: NodeContext: eyes closed as he pores through his memories... the 'hmmm'is like the sound you might make when looking through a list of appointments, or spreadsheet for a particular entry. Impatient.

Archivist_125.speaker: Archivist
Archivist_125.context: NodeContext: eyes closed as he pores through his memories... the 'hmmm'is like the sound you might make when looking through a list of appointments, or spreadsheet for a particular entry. Growing irritation as he can't find what he's looking for.

Archivist_127.speaker: Narrator
Archivist_127.text: *His eyes flicker back and forth as if he is reading a book. He has the schedule memorised... or it's carved into his eyelids.*

Archivist_74.speaker: Archivist
Archivist_74.text: Most irregular. The schedule is all but clear. And yet you are here.
Archivist_74.context: NodeContext: looking at the player suspiciously and a little bit predatory. Intentional rhyme

Archivist_33.speaker: Player
Archivist_33.text: I just want to explore the Archive.

Archivist_90.speaker: Archivist
Archivist_90.text: Be my guest. Even if you're not scheduled for an appointment, this is a civilised place.
Archivist_90.context: NodeContext: welcoming, but with a sinister edge

Archivist_51.speaker: Archivist
Archivist_51.text: As long as you don't remove any of the artefacts, nobody will remove your skin.
Archivist_51.context: NodeContext: polite, but with a sadistic smile

Archivist_109.speaker: Archivist
Archivist_109.text: Unless Master Raphael decides otherwise, of course.
Archivist_109.context: NodeContext: polite, but with a sadistic smile

Archivist_97.speaker: Player
Archivist_97.text: Are there any highlights in the collection?

Archivist_96.speaker: Archivist
Archivist_96.text: And of course, the Orphic Hammer itself is the prize of the collection.
Archivist_96.context: NodeContext: with reverence - he loves the collection, and this artefact most of all

Archivist_117.speaker: Archivist
Archivist_117.text: The Orphic Hammer is one of Master Raphael's most prized possessions. You can't have it. You can't even touch it. And I would suggest you don't think about it.
Archivist_117.context: NodeContext: with reverence - he loves the collection, and this artefact most of all - politely chiding the player for asking about it on the phrases starting 'you can't have it'

Archivist_52.speaker: Player
Archivist_52.text: I just want to admire the craftsmanship.

Archivist_17.speaker: Archivist
Archivist_17.text: It is exquisite. The master cast it himself, you know, using metals gathered from the depths of the Hells.
Archivist_17.context: NodeContext: with reverence - he loves the collection, and this artefact most of all

Archivist_11.speaker: Archivist
Archivist_11.text: Excellent! You can admire it with your eyes, from a distance.
Archivist_11.context: NodeContext: faux-delight on the first word. Then sarcastic as he shooes the player away

Archivist_64.speaker: Player
Archivist_64.text: How about I break bits of you until you change your mind?

Archivist_15.speaker: Player
Archivist_15.text: I think I can use the Hammer to save the world.

Archivist_58.speaker: Archivist
Archivist_58.text: The long centuries of pain and suffering must be making me sentimental.
Archivist_58.context: NodeContext: with an exasperated sigh - sincere, but annoyed with himself

Archivist_41.speaker: Archivist
Archivist_41.text: If the Hammer can save millions of souls, who am I to stand in your way? After all, a saved world is a fine future prospect for exploitation.
Archivist_41.context: NodeContext: first phrase is sincere, second phrase is is more sinister

Archivist_42.speaker: Archivist
Archivist_42.text: Which world? There are so many, and so few of them are worth saving.

Archivist_6.speaker: Archivist
Archivist_6.text: No. I think the Hammer shall stay exactly where it is.
Archivist_6.context: NodeContext: made up his mind. matter of fact

Archivist_21.speaker: Player
Archivist_21.text: I'm a client of Raphael's, and had second thoughts about the terms of my deal.

Archivist_13.speaker: Archivist
Archivist_13.text: I commend you! Thinking is a marvellous pastime.

Archivist_135.speaker: Archivist
Archivist_135.text: You should have third, fourth, and fifth thoughts about your deal as well. You can think about all the ways you're never going to break it.

Archivist_68.speaker: Player
Archivist_68.text: I don't want to break it - Raphael said I could make some edits and clarifications to the wording.

Archivist_50.speaker: Archivist
Archivist_50.text: Tsk. He can be so indulgent of his favourites.

Archivist_121.speaker: Archivist
Archivist_121.text: While most irregular, I shall take your preposterous request into consideration.
Archivist_121.context: NodeContext: annoyed, having to indulge a foolish request that he thinks is beneath his station

Archivist_45.speaker: Archivist
Archivist_45.text: Submitting the necessary paperwork will take no more than six infernal cycles, amounting to thirty-seven of your mortal years.
Archivist_45.context: NodeContext: he loves the bureaucracy; he's very aware that the person he's talking to won't.

Archivist_67.speaker: Archivist
Archivist_67.text: I recommend you indulge in the pleasurable torments of the boudoir while you wait.
Archivist_67.context: NodeContext: delivers this as if it's the most ordinary thing in the world to send someone to a 'boudoir' - same energy as a local council worker sending you to a waiting room

Archivist_82.speaker: Archivist
Archivist_82.text: Sadly, and to my shame, my key has slipped from my pocket. You will have to penetrate the boudoir's depths using your own cunning.

Archivist_57.speaker: Archivist
Archivist_57.text: It is where Raphael conducts his most private matters of business and pleasure. You will need this to gain access.
Archivist_57.context: NodeContext: hand-off small key-like device off-screen on final phrase. No need for object to be visible. Big emphasis on the 'and'. He's more interested in the business than the pleasure.

Archivist_19.speaker: Archivist
Archivist_19.text: The resident favours their favourites. Satisfy them, and they may put in a good word on your behalf.
Archivist_19.context: NodeContext: he's ending hte conversation here, and returning to his work. Glad to be done with us after offering this final tidbit of advice

Archivist_131.speaker: Archivist
Archivist_131.text: Why not wait here until the master returns? He'll be able to verify your extraordinary claim immediately.
Archivist_131.context: NodeContext: With a smile - he knows this is a terrible offer - the player really doesn't want to meet 'the Master'(Raphael)

Archivist_108.speaker: Player
Archivist_108.text: How about I break bits of you until you tell me how to get what I want?

Archivist_80.speaker: Archivist
Archivist_80.text: I'd rather you didn't. My spine has only just healed from the last time the master shattered it.

Archivist_30.speaker: Archivist
Archivist_30.text: Wholly deserved, of course. I spilled a glass of Baatezu Blood Wine on one of his favourite portraits.
Archivist_30.context: NodeContext: BAH-teh-zu (a kind of devil, but here used as a sort of brand name). regretful

Archivist_83.speaker: Archivist
Archivist_83.text: Perhaps you could work off some of this aggression in the boudoir.
Archivist_83.context: NodeContext: delivers this as if it's the most ordinary thing in the world to send someone to a 'boudoir' - same energy as a local council worker sending you to a waiting room

Archivist_53.speaker: Archivist
Archivist_53.text: There are few bits of me that haven't been broken already.

Archivist_123.speaker: Archivist
Archivist_123.text: You're more than welcome to do your very worst. I'll have the guards stop you if it starts to tickle.

Archivist_137.speaker: Player
Archivist_137.text: Raphael won't care about losing one measly contract. Just let me have it, and I'll leave.

Archivist_118.speaker: Archivist
Archivist_118.text: Your presence is already an irritant more distressing than the stings of a thousand hellwasps, so I would prefer that you do leave.
Archivist_118.context: NodeContext: extremely irritated, but not losing his veneer of polite bureaucracy

Archivist_124.speaker: Archivist
Archivist_124.text: Take your insolent buzzing to the boudoir. You won't learn any manners there, but you might expand your imagination.
Archivist_124.context: NodeContext: delivers this as if it's the most ordinary thing in the world to send someone to a 'boudoir' - same energy as a local council worker sending you to a waiting room

Archivist_92.speaker: Archivist
Archivist_92.text: Or have your tongue twisted so tightly you won't be able to bother me with your outrageous requests.

Archivist_70.speaker: Archivist
Archivist_70.text: I'm afraid you don't realise quite how much you mean to the master. He would be inconsolable if he lost that contract.
Archivist_70.context: NodeContext: faux-respectful, but really he's turning down our request

Archivist_132.speaker: Archivist
Archivist_132.text: But if you're so keen to break it, why not wait until he comes home and discuss the matter with him face-to-face?
Archivist_132.context: NodeContext: With a smile - he knows this is a terrible offer - the player really doesn't want to meet 'the Master'(Raphael)

Archivist_107.speaker: Player
Archivist_107.text: I am Karlach Demonsbane. I represent my mistress, Archduchess Zariel, and am acting as her High Inquisitor.

Archivist_134.speaker: Player
Archivist_134.text: I am Verillius Receptor, Zariel's High Inquisitor.

Archivist_77.speaker: Archivist
Archivist_77.text: A thousand apologies, oh majestic magistrate of the infernal court! Your mortal guise is so vile, I found it perfectly convincing.
Archivist_77.context: NodeContext: servile in the extreme - thinks he's talking to an incredibly important person

Archivist_23.speaker: Archivist
Archivist_23.text: I would prostrate myself before you and kiss your calluses, but my spine is ruptured in a thousand places.

Archivist_4.speaker: Archivist
Archivist_4.text: You do know how Raphael likes to play.
Archivist_4.context: NodeContext: apologetic and with a slight grin

Archivist_85.speaker: Archivist
Archivist_85.text: As always, the Archive is yours to peruse. You'll find everything accounted for, and I can present documents of procurement if necessary.

Archivist_130.speaker: Player
Archivist_130.text: I'm looking for a particular contract, belonging to [GEN_PlayerName_c11eee1e-7815-6143-7233-f2427799fa53].

Archivist_40.speaker: Archivist
Archivist_40.text: Of course, of course. It is highly prized due to the unique potential of the soul it is bound to.
Archivist_40.context: NodeContext: curator proudly describing artefacts in a collection

Archivist_71.speaker: Archivist
Archivist_71.text: I don't understand the appeal of them myself, but Raphael does dote after mortals so.
Archivist_71.context: NodeContext: like a butler joking about his superior in an affectionate way - 'you know how he is'

Archivist_46.speaker: Archivist
Archivist_46.text: As part of the special collection, that item is guarded by a masterword that even I do not know.
Archivist_46.context: NodeContext: curator proudly describing artefacts in a collection

Archivist_126.speaker: Archivist
Archivist_126.text: I suggest you wait until Raphael returns, and you can discuss the matter with him. You are welcome to relax in the boudoir until then.

Archivist_98.speaker: Archivist
Archivist_98.text: The resident of the boudoir will wish to explore every inch of your new form. And I'm sure you would be happy to share.

Archivist_3.speaker: Player
Archivist_3.text: I'd like to see the Hammer, please.

Archivist_26.speaker: Archivist
Archivist_26.text: An exquisite and most unique artefact. Crafted with materials hewn from the depths of the Hells by Raphael's merregon labour force.
Archivist_26.context: NodeContext: curator proudly describing artefacts in a collection

Archivist_75.speaker: Archivist
Archivist_75.text: As it was created by Raphael himself, we have no documents of procurement, nor do we require any. But if you wish to examine the artefact itself, you are more than welcome.
Archivist_75.context: NodeContext: curator proudly describing artefacts in a collection

Archivist_34.speaker: Player
Archivist_34.text: Could I take a look at the Crown of Karsus?

Archivist_105.speaker: Archivist
Archivist_105.text: Ha ha. Ahem. Most droll, Inquisitor. As you well know, the Crown of Karsus is lost.
Archivist_105.context: NodeContext: nervous laughter - this is an uncomfortable topic

Archivist_54.speaker: Archivist
Archivist_54.text: Stolen from Mephistopheles by gods-kissing mortals. My master certainly had nothing to do with any of that business.
Archivist_54.context: NodeContext: nervous laughter - this is an uncomfortable topic

Archivist_44.speaker: Player
Archivist_44.text: I might have to confiscate some of these artefacts.

Archivist_114.speaker: Archivist
Archivist_114.text: You may examine them, oh diabolical dominatrix, but they cannot be removed unless you present a writ of Infernal Requisition, with Article 152 correctly filled out.

Archivist_119.speaker: Player
Archivist_119.text: Any new highlights in the collection?

Archivist_112.speaker: Archivist
Archivist_112.text: A fine pair of gauntlets that allow the wearer to twist the head from even the most resilient malingerer.
Archivist_112.context: NodeContext: curator proudly describing artefacts in a collection

Archivist_89.speaker: Archivist
Archivist_89.text: An amulet that causes the blood to surge, and the heart to swell. Along with other parts. Most invigorating.
Archivist_89.context: NodeContext: curator proudly describing artefacts in a collection

Archivist_65.speaker: Archivist
Archivist_65.text: And, awaiting installation, we have secured a rod that gathers the Weave around it in great quantities, just as surely as shit gathers flies.
Archivist_65.context: NodeContext: curator proudly describing artefacts in a collection

Archivist_76.speaker: Player
Archivist_76.text: I am Verillius Receptor, Zariel's High Inquisitor.

Archivist_101.speaker: Archivist
Archivist_101.text: You most certainly are not. And whoever you are, you are already trying my extremely limited patience.

Archivist_87.speaker: Player
Archivist_87.text: Access the schedule by reading his thoughts.

Archivist_43.speaker: Archivist
Archivist_43.text: Trying to see my thoughts? There are too many - and they're all mine!

Archivist_93.speaker: Archivist
Archivist_93.text: No visitors expected other than Korrilla Hearthflame and Verillius Receptor, Zariel's High Inquisitor.
Archivist_93.context: NodeContext: calmly as if reading from a list of appointments

Archivist_72.speaker: Archivist
Archivist_72.text: All visitors arrived on schedule. Korrilla Hearthflame wished to peruse the Archive, and the Inquisitor was in a most grotesque form.
Archivist_72.context: NodeContext: calmly as if reading from a list of appointments

Archivist_7.speaker: Archivist
Archivist_7.text: Yes. Nasty little gadfly. I'd swat her if the master wasn't so fond of tormenting her.

Archivist_115.speaker: Karlach
Archivist_115.context: NodeContext: Responding to something nasty said

Archivist_111.speaker: Archivist
Archivist_111.text: You are stupendously lugubrious this day, High Inquisitor. An inspiration to us all.

Archivist_116.speaker: Archivist
Archivist_116.context: NodeContext: annoyed, wants to get back to work

AD_ArchivistAlarmComment_0.speaker: Archivist
AD_ArchivistAlarmComment_0.text: Ah, you've summoned master Raphael. And I hadn't finished dusting the artefacts yet. He'll be most annoyed.

AD_ArchivistAlarmComment_1.speaker: Archivist
AD_ArchivistAlarmComment_1.text: You just rang Raphael's dinner bell, and you're the entire menu.

MerregonDebtor01_11.speaker: Theologist Eternal Debtor
MerregonDebtor01_11.text: You look as fresh as the day you arrived.

MerregonDebtor01_20.speaker: Theologist Eternal Debtor
MerregonDebtor01_20.text: Welcome! It is so good to see a new face.

MerregonDebtor01_23.speaker: Theologist Eternal Debtor
MerregonDebtor01_23.text: Who am I? I do not know. Who was I? I can answer.

MerregonDebtor01_8.speaker: Theologist Eternal Debtor
MerregonDebtor01_8.text: A priest. I spent most of my life singing praise to a god who did not listen. Ha ha!

MerregonDebtor01_1.speaker: Theologist Eternal Debtor
MerregonDebtor01_1.text: A thousand prayers with no reply. Imagine it.

MerregonDebtor01_15.speaker: Theologist Eternal Debtor
MerregonDebtor01_15.text: Raphael answered the first time I called out to him.

MerregonDebtor01_2.speaker: Player
MerregonDebtor01_2.text: What did you ask of Raphael?

MerregonDebtor01_21.speaker: Theologist Eternal Debtor
MerregonDebtor01_21.text: Not riches or miracles. Just enough coin to keep my family happy and healthy.

MerregonDebtor01_13.speaker: Theologist Eternal Debtor
MerregonDebtor01_13.text: Raphael delivered. And then I was delivered to him.

MerregonDebtor01_12.speaker: Theologist Eternal Debtor
MerregonDebtor01_12.text: I do not remember. Perhaps they never existed, and I sang my prayers into the void.

MerregonDebtor01_19.speaker: Player
MerregonDebtor01_19.text: Perhaps what you asked of your god was impossible.

MerregonDebtor01_24.speaker: Theologist Eternal Debtor
MerregonDebtor01_24.text: It was not so much to ask.

MerregonDebtor01_4.speaker: Player
MerregonDebtor01_4.text: It is not for us to make demands of the gods.

MerregonDebtor01_17.speaker: Theologist Eternal Debtor
MerregonDebtor01_17.text: And yet they make so many demands of us? It is not fair. Raphael has taken everything from me, but, oh, the things he gave me in exchange.

MerregonDebtor01_9.speaker: Player
MerregonDebtor01_9.text: The gods do not always answer clearly, but I'm sure they tried to give you what you needed.

MerregonDebtor01_14.speaker: Player
MerregonDebtor01_14.text: How long have you been in the House of Hope?

MerregonDebtor01_7.speaker: Theologist Eternal Debtor
MerregonDebtor01_7.text: Long enough to forget the faces of my family.

MerregonDebtor01_22.speaker: Theologist Eternal Debtor
MerregonDebtor01_22.text: Plenty. Raphael brings new guests all the time. Some faces don't stay fresh for very long, though.

AD_HopeSaved_0.speaker: Hope
AD_HopeSaved_0.text: I had no idea that would actually work.
AD_HopeSaved_0.context: NodeContext: amazed and relieved, but not loud. Almost talking to herself

AD_HopeSaved_1.speaker: Hope
AD_HopeSaved_1.text: JUST TELL ME WHO TO KILL
AD_HopeSaved_1.context: NodeContext: finally free, and sees that there's a fight happening - excited to get her hands bloody

AD_HopeSaved_2.speaker: Hope
AD_HopeSaved_2.text: THANK YOU SO SO SO SO MUCH

AD_DamnedSoul19_0.speaker: Errant Soul
AD_DamnedSoul19_0.text: All of the residents were guests, and all of the guests will be residents.

Debtors_CrimeReaction_0.speaker: Narrator
Debtors_CrimeReaction_0.text: *This debtor has realised you're not on Raphael's guestlist, and he's about to raise the alarm.*

Debtors_CrimeReaction_1.speaker: Narrator
Debtors_CrimeReaction_1.text: *Without Hope's disguise, the damned soul realises you are an imposter in the hells, and is about to raise the alarm.*

AD_Raphael_Plaque2_0.speaker: Narrator
AD_Raphael_Plaque2_0.text: *Flock to me, all who are burdened, and I will give you hope, for my house is yours, and the door is always open.*

AD_InfernalGem_0.speaker: Narrator
AD_InfernalGem_0.text: *An Infernal gem, seething in its cage, protecting the secrets of its master.*

AD_RaphaelGone_0.speaker: Narrator
AD_RaphaelGone_0.text: *No more contracts, no more debts. The master of the house has been put to sleep, for good.*

AD_RaphaelGone_1.speaker: Narrator
AD_RaphaelGone_1.text: *No more Devils, no more debts. With its master gone, the house is nothing more now than an empty carcass.*

AD_RaphaelGone_2.speaker: Narrator
AD_RaphaelGone_2.text: *The Devil was defeated in his own home. Now Hope can prevail once more.*

ImpDebtor04_0.speaker: Devoured Eternal Debtor
ImpDebtor04_0.text: Teeth, claws. They want out. They want out of me!
ImpDebtor04_0.context: NodeContext: Doubled over in pain, rats are swen inside him.

ImpDebtor04_1.speaker: Devoured Eternal Debtor
ImpDebtor04_1.text: They're eating me from the inside. The rats, the rats, the rats!
ImpDebtor04_1.context: NodeContext: Doubled over in pain, rats are swen inside him.

AD_Raphael_Plaque3_0.speaker: Narrator
AD_Raphael_Plaque3_0.text: *When debts are paid, and afflictions cured, rejoice in the new life granted to you by my benevolence.*

PAD_PortalWaterdeep_0.speaker: Player
PAD_PortalWaterdeep_0.text: Waterdeep - the forces of the Absolute could threaten even the City of Splendours if they were to reach it.

AD_DamnedSoul18_0.speaker: Errant Soul
AD_DamnedSoul18_0.text: I've been awake for a hundred years. Let me rest.

AD_CantUsePortal_0.speaker: Narrator
AD_CantUsePortal_0.text: *You'll need everyone together before you proceed.*

AD_ArchivistNoticesHope_0.speaker: Archivist
AD_ArchivistNoticesHope_0.text: Hope? Here? She is not permitted to stretch her legs - we stretch them for her.

DealWithContract_2.speaker: Narrator
DealWithContract_2.text: *This piece of humble parchment contains your promise to give Raphael the Crown of Karsus. Without it, you are unbound from him forever.*

DealWithContract_5.speaker: Narrator
DealWithContract_5.text: *Your blood suddenly runs cold. Raphael knows what you've done.*
DealWithContract_5.context:
CinematicNodeContext: Player rips the contract (off screen) - shoot around and achieve this with sound, then looks up, as though surprised/ worried.

[SCENE]  REUSE RS: SCENE_GLO_Book_Lockpick_Fail_PLYR (cut in close to hide hands, trim anim and use on hard cut - talk to Ellen if needed)

AD_PortalWaterdeep_0.speaker: Narrator
AD_PortalWaterdeep_0.context: NodeContext: Slightly editorial description from the narrator in Raphael's House of Hope, nestled in a demonic realm.

AD_Raphael_Combat_02_0.speaker: Raphael
AD_Raphael_Combat_02_0.text: You should never have come here.

HopeSpirit_Alarm_13.text: DING DING DING YOU JUST RANG THE DINNER BELL AND RAPHAEL'S COMING HOME TO FEAST

HopeSpirit_Alarm_10.text: He'll have your guts for starters, and your soul for dessert. SOULS TASTE LIKE HONEYED TARTS.

HopeSpirit_Alarm_20.text: I'VE GOT GOOD NEWS. AND BAD NEWS. AND WORST NEWS.
HopeSpirit_Alarm_20.context: NodeContext: outburst, optimistic on first phrase, then a brief pause and the realisation that there is also 'bad news'. Downbeat. And then another brief pause and the announcement that there is also 'worse news'. Increasingly stressed. 'Worst' rather than 'worse' is intentional

HopeSpirit_Alarm_11.text: Good news! You got what you came for - successful visit, great success. Fantastic work!
HopeSpirit_Alarm_11.context: NodeContext: Cheering herself up with the announcement of 'good news!'. Hurriedly delivers the positive verdict on our work so far.

HopeSpirit_Alarm_23.text: Bad news - so many things will be on fire when you step outside of this room. YOU INCLUDED. That's okay, though, right? It's Hell! You expected it to be hot.
HopeSpirit_Alarm_23.context: NodeContext: running through the bad news as quickly as possible - trying to emphasise that this is fine. It's really not that bad. Emphasiis on 'YOU INCLUDED' is a somewhat panicked outburst, and she composes herself on the next line, reassuring herself and the player

HopeSpirit_Alarm_9.text: WORST NEWS RAPHAEL IS ON HIS WAY HOME AND OH BOY OH BOY HE IS SPITTING MAD
HopeSpirit_Alarm_9.context: NodeContext: outburst, grimacing, not too loud, not treating this as the possible death sentence it is in reality, trying to make the situation seem less dire than it is

HopeSpirit_Alarm_19.text: But you planned for this, I know you did. You have everything under control.
HopeSpirit_Alarm_19.context: NodeContext: composing herself, and calming the player

HopeSpirit_Alarm_15.text: IT'S REALLY IMPORTANT THAT YOU DON'T PANIC EVEN WHEN YOUR EYES EVAPORATE FROM THE HEAT
HopeSpirit_Alarm_15.context: NodeContext: outburst, intense, attempting to reassurebut going aobut it very badly

HopeSpirit_Alarm_16.text: Come to my prison, bring the Hammer, break my chains. And then we exit stage ANYWHICHWAY.
HopeSpirit_Alarm_16.context: NodeContext: hurriedly giving instructions in a bit of a panic

HopeSpirit_Alarm_1.text: oh god no oh please no oh no no no no no no no
HopeSpirit_Alarm_1.context: NodeContext: quiet muttering to herself in utter despair, feeling abandoned

HopeSpirit_Alarm_27.text: THEN YOU NEED TO MAKE IT BETTER AND GET US OUT OF HERE
HopeSpirit_Alarm_27.context: NodeContext: voice raised, imploring the player to keep calm when she can't

HopeSpirit_Alarm_6.text: QUICK AS A COCKROACH LICKETY-SPLIT IF YOU DON'T MIND
HopeSpirit_Alarm_6.context: NodeContext: outburst of jovial chiding to hurrry the player along

HopeSpirit_Alarm_29.text: I'm sure we've both made mistakes, and this would be a bad time to start blaming one another.

HopeSpirit_Alarm_22.text: BUT I AM ALMOST ENTIRELY CERTAIN I EMPHASISED HOW IMPORTANT THE HAMMER IS
HopeSpirit_Alarm_22.context: NodeContext: outburst of panic and frustration

HopeSpirit_Alarm_5.text: But you seem to have forgotten it, and now we're both going to die. Goodbye, it was terrible knowing you.
HopeSpirit_Alarm_5.context: NodeContext: composing herself as she rushes out what she fully expects to be a final goodbye

HopeSpirit_Alarm_31.text: Vandalism, thievery, murder, dawdling-with-intent. What crime did you commit?
HopeSpirit_Alarm_31.context: NodeContext: curious, listing out the only crimes she can think of, then asking gently which one the player committed

HopeSpirit_Alarm_26.text: Doesn't matter because it was the WRONG CRIME. You didn't steal what you came for.
HopeSpirit_Alarm_26.context: NodeContext: building toward an increase of volume on 'WRONG CRIME'. Then composing herself to deliver the last sentence

HopeSpirit_Alarm_12.text: But there's no turning back - you need to LEAVE. And you need to take me with you.
HopeSpirit_Alarm_12.context: NodeContext: urgent, intense, panicking a little

HopeSpirit_Alarm_17.text: COME TO ME ACROSS THE HALL BRING THE HAMMER BREAK MY CHAINS
HopeSpirit_Alarm_17.context: NodeContext: outburst as she provides instructions hurriedly and with intensity

HopeSpirit_Alarm_24.text: Then we can get your contract.

HopeSpirit_Alarm_2.text: But without the hammer, you can't take me anywhere. Find the HAMMER. Cross the HALL. Break my CHAINS.
HopeSpirit_Alarm_2.context: NodeContext: panicking and fretting. Emphasising the nouns on the instructions to make sure it's very clear what she needs the player to do

AD_DamnedSoul14_0.speaker: Errant Soul
AD_DamnedSoul14_0.text: Oh, to be nothing. To be gone for good.

AD_HopePreparesForRaphael_3.speaker: Hope
AD_HopePreparesForRaphael_3.text: There are three things you need to know about Raphael.

AD_HopePreparesForRaphael_4.speaker: Hope
AD_HopePreparesForRaphael_4.text: He's almost home now - closer than a kiss.

AD_HopePreparesForRaphael_1.speaker: Hope
AD_HopePreparesForRaphael_1.context: NodeContext: stated as if an obvious true fact

AD_HopePreparesForRaphael_0.speaker: Hope
AD_HopePreparesForRaphael_0.text: And he probably knows a thousand ways to kill us.

AD_KorrillaLeaves_0.speaker: Korrilla
AD_KorrillaLeaves_0.text: He's not going to like that. And he's not going to find me standing next to you.

AD_ArchivistReactionOnKillingSkeletons_0.speaker: Archivist
